loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build a washstand, bathroom, and install drinking water in her home.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem is 25 years old, married, and resides with her widowed mother, her husband, and her two young children in a village in the Kandal province in Cambodia. She has worked as a factory worker since 2013 and her husband is a 22-year-old construction worker. Both Chem and her husband can earn around $8 each day. 

Her present house is old and she would like to build a proper house but she lacks the money to buy lumber. That’s why she is now requesting a loan. This loan will help her have enough funds to build a proper house to live in and provide her family with better living conditions. In the future, she is going to support her children in earning high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a proper house

loans.name: Hon

texts.en: In the picture, Hon is on the right and his wife is on the left. Hon, 55, and his spouse, Chom, 52, live in a community of Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. The couple has seven children in total; five are single and live under the same roof, while the other two are married and live independently. Hon is a fisherman who can earn, on average, an income of USD 3.00 a day. So far, he has been in this career for around 20 years. His current boat is pretty old and he wants to replace it with a new one but he cannot afford it. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a new boat. This loan will make a great contribution in developing his career as well as his living standard. He is thankful to the all lenders for their kind financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the snacks

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 46, has a small farm based in the village of Kuserwo , which is situated in the North Rift region of Kenya. She has been a farmer for six years to provide for her family. Her primary income sources are selling milk and crops. Mary enjoys farming a lot. 

Looking after her cattle, however, is quickly becoming a serious challenge because her cattle stray from the designated grazing area into other people's farms. The consequences can be very severe, leading to disputes which can escalate to violence and hostility. Mary seeks a loan to pay for a fencing wire to enclose her farmland. 

The loan will enable Mary to have small fenced paddocks to make stock more intensive. The paddocks will also be used to build up feed supply, which will also force the stock to graze a wider range of plants and allow the plants to recover after grazing.  When asked how the loan would benefit her family, she replied, "Improves security in my compound, improves stock management, and keeps my neighbors happy".

loans.use: To buy fencing wire to build paddocks to prevent her cattle from straying

loans.name: Juliester

texts.en:
Hello world: meet Juliester. She is a smallholder farmer based in Kinoro village, which is found in the Central region of Kenya. The 29-year-old farmer started in 2008 with a dairy cow and poultry for milk and eggs. As of today, she has also ventured into crop farming both for sale and consumption. She sells her produce at Nkubu which is one of the fastest growing towns in Africa. 

Juliester is seeking a loan to venture into banana farming. Growing bananas does not require much effort, but to achieve high yields requires skills, dedication, and proper planting methods. Juliester, who has two children, feels she is cut out for it. She has adequate space at the 1 acre farm she owns for this project. 

Returns from this investment will enable Juliester to pay for food, which is her highest monthly expense when she is not servicing a loan. She managed to attain a secondary education herself. With your investment, she will make enough income to educate her children and even further her own education if the stars align.

loans.use: To start banana farming

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is nothing short of a visionary farmer. She is based in the outskirts of Kapsowar town, in the North Rift region of Kenya. Her house, covered with corrugated iron sheet, is at the center of a compound within her luxuriant farm. She started farming in 2009. Today, she makes money from selling milk, planting different varieties of food crops and a side hustle business to supplement her meager income. However, surrounded by fresh air, wide open space, and peaceful, natural sounds, she cherishes every minute spent with her cows. 

Milka is seeking a loan to purchase more land. Her operations are growing consistently, eating up the available space. With your funding, Milka will have more space to expand her business output. The money from the investment will be reinvested back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable Milka to repay the loan, buy food for her family, and pay fees for her children who are in public schools.
Help push Milka’s dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to buy land to expand her farm

loans.name: Annie Grace

texts.en:
Annie Grace is 44 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annie Grace has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, at 39 years old, is a charismatic, ever-smiling, active and attentive mother. She is happily married and blessed with three children. Being still young and full of energy, she has been practicing farming for the past twenty years, and has been making profits. Her farming involves feeding and attending to her animals. Her primary source of income is selling milk, maize, vegetables and some small business she does to make ends meet. 

When asked what’s the most enjoyable bit about farming she answered, “I get food to eat and to sell”. Catherine has extensive land and has planted enough grass. She has always wanted to buy a good dairy breed of dairy goat, but the challenge he has been facing is a lack of finances. That is why she is seeking funds to make her dream a reality. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, she will make her dream a reality because these institutions are all about helping small-scale farmers better their livelihood. She underwent training with Juhudi Kilimo and has learned that microfinance helps the poor access financing and helps them in their projects. She says that through the loan, she will increase her milk production and therefore increase her income level. Profits from the loan will be used to repay the loan and secure the future of her young family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat for increased milk production

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a parent born in 1988 in Kapsowar and he wants the best for his family. He engages in crop and dairy farming as a source of living with the help of her wife, who is also a farmer. He aims to have a better income for his family. 

So, he decided to take a loan to practice horticulture and to be able to satisfy the already demand that is there in their market. This will result in improved living conditions
Elijah’s plan for the future is to be the leader in horticulture farming and secure the future of his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Shareefah

texts.en:
While increasing the life troubles and growing cruelty, come family problems increased tension and pain and the husband has divorced his wife to live his life away from his wife who supported him throughout their life, leaving her with five children who were the fruits of these failed marriage.

The tragedy of the wife increased because of the difficult living conditions, but the wife became determined to rely on herself and to prove to her society that women have an active and positive role in the life.

Shareefah is 30 years old single mother and lives with her five kids in Dairalla, her husband was working with good incomes to provide the needs for his kids, after he divorced from Shareefah, she decided to start her own business which is poultry and breeding livestock, and that is helping her to provide living for her kids without any externals help, she is working hard to provide good life for her kids and depends on herself.

Today Shareefah wants to build large barn to protect livestock from the high heat of the sun, but she does not have money, therefore she applied for a loan to help her build the barn and to buy supplies for her livestock and poultry.

loans.use: to build a large barn to protect livestock from the high heat of the sun

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem  is 49 years old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her nephew. She has been successfully running a small general store for the past 5 years. Over the time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet her household expenses. 

Currently, she has availed Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater maximum customers for generating healthier source of income

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma  has successfully established her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 35000 PKR  to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors to increase her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors to increase her sales and profits alongside

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To eaxpand the range of goods she sells from her foodshop.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida  has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits

loans.name: Mkombozi Mwenge Group

texts.en:
Eliasi, a businessman aged early 40s, is married and has two daughters who are still at school. He supports his family with a chicken business(local chickens).  He travel a distance to villages to buy them. Its takes one week for Eliasi to get stock from villages and to sell.  20years, is the period he has been in this business and he started with few chickens till his current level of 300 to 400 chickens per week. He is able to realize a good profit each month.

This is his fourth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Mkombozi, five members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous loans to grow his capital( bought more chickens to rise income), currently with 400 chickens. He is doing great and appreciate Kiva's support. 

In the coming years, Eliasi would like to be successfully with his project. He earned business profit which he used to buy plot and built a house for his family.He has paid back all previous loans successfully. 
With this new credit request, Eliasi will invest part of it to buy 300 local chickens for his business to resell,preparing for the coming Muslim holiday.

loans.use: to buy 300 local chickens for his business to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old, single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Rafah is not good, A few years ago, Ahmad decided to started his own business. 

He manages a store for selling home equipment and furniture he sells his products in a neighboring markets. He is the only breadwinner for the family, and they depend on him for support. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of furniture for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: buy a new collection of furniture for his store

loans.name: Rexillen Marie

texts.en:
Rexillen Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has one child. She has a business selling rice in the Philippines.

Rexillen Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Rexillen Marie has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 71 years old, married, and has four children. 

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming sugarcane for ten years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn is a 47-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur with a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like nails, wood, varnish and other materials for her business.

Merelyn has been in this business for 26 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like nails, wood, varnish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza is a 37-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa in addition to the cocoa garden that gives her good yields. She used the previous loan to buy cocoa to sell where she managed to make tangible benefits as she works hard to look after her family, especially paying school fees for her children.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 45, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kandal province and a mother of four children. Nowadays, she needs to support on three schoolchildren. For her family’s hardship, she grows rice as her single main source of income. She can get little yield from her farm, because it did not has enough water to support her rice farm. She has involved this business for 25 years and it earns her about 39,300 KHR per day. 

For Chanthou, this is her thirteen cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. Her past loans earned her good income to keep her children in school as well. She leads a group of six members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support on her farming to get good yield. She hopes that she can get more yields from her rice farm than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farming to get a good yield.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 47 years old and a married mother of three children who are all in school. Nowadays she is living with her family in a wooden house located in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. Phalla tries to overcome her family’s hardship through sugar growing and sugar selling to earn income to support her family. 

Due to lack of money to support her children’s studying, she is now applying for this first Kiva loan via VisionFund to pay for her children’s school fee in order to pave the way for her children to get good jobs. She hopes that this loan will help her children to be highly-educated people and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fee in order to pave the way for her children to get good jobs

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en: With the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva, Fareeda has successfully built her business manufacturing footballs. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of money to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more rubber bladders, leather covers, thread, and needles to increase her sales. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more rubbler bladders, leather covers, thread, and needles to manufacture footballs

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela  is 56 years old, hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Jameela ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Jameela  has availed a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motor to repair a mill for her business.

loans.name: Mkombozi A Group

texts.en:
Halima is the mother of four kids who are in school. She is in her early 30s and married. For five years now, she has been supporting her family by running a beauty salon, with herself being a hairstylist. She starts working from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her seventh credit request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to improve her service, bought a business dryer and hair steamer and hair products, and paid rent for her business premises. She is really appreciative of Kiva's support. 

Halima dreams of improving and expanding her business. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She received some extra income which she used to cover part of the school fees and household expenses.

With her new credit request, Halima will invest to start selling women's clothes at her beauty salon. She will share this credit with her members from Mkombozi A group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling women's clothes at her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mkombozi B Group

texts.en:
Dallia is late 30s,married and has got three daughters who are at school. 15 years, he has been a food vendor (mamalishe), cooking rice,stiff porridge with meat,beans and vegetables. She also serve tea with chapati and other snacks. Dallia starts working from 06am to 06pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly return. 

This is her third credit request from Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credits,paid back successfully, to improve her food business with enough stock of rice,beans,sugar,cooking oil,maize and baking flour. Dallia made profit which she used to cover school fees for her daughters and part of household expenses. She dreams of expanding her business to hotel level. 

She will invest part of this credit to buy kilos of rice,beans,liters of cooking oil,baking and maize flour for her mamalishe. She will share this loan with her group members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy kilos of rice, beans, liters of cooking oil, baking and maize flour for her mamalishe.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is a 33 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, all of them are still attending school. Her husband is the main income sources in the family in order to enhance their way of living. He has been working as a mechanical for many years. Hanaa hopes to help her children with their education. 

For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner vitas s.a.l to pay the first installment of the study fees.  She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their master’s degree.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children's study fees

loans.name: Itaf

texts.en:
Itaf is a 28-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She is a housewife dedicated only for her family, and her husband works in order to satisfy their needs. 

Due to the hard financial situation, today she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 35 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child still attending school. Her husband is the main income source and works untiringly to satisfy the necessities of life and till now he earns a fair revenue. 

That’s why, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the coming school year what makes her very satisfied.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Aileen has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Aileen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Aljen

texts.en:
Aljen is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aljen is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Aljen has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Aljen requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Aljen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Aljen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Milma

texts.en:
Milma is 38 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, and personal care products

Milma has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, coffee, and personal care products

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Belinda is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Belinda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Belinda requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Belinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 43 year old male married with four children, three attending school living in Kasese. He deals in general merchandise and textiles alongside getting additional income from salary earning. He has been in business since 2008. 

He needs a loan to buy roofing materials like iron sheets and nails. He faces challenges of bad weather,market competition, inflation and business expenses like high rental costs. He has hopes of educating his children and completing his permanent house for his children.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials like iron sheets and nails

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Clara works very hard to provide for them.

Clara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Clara has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Clara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kandal province, Sok is 36 years old and a mother of five children. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family’s living via working as a construction worker. Moreover, she grows rice to get more income. Her rice grows not well because of drought. She can save her daily income about 28,000 KHR per day. 

For Sok, this is her fifth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. With her past loans, it makes her family living in better condition. In a group of three, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support on her farming to increase her crop yields. She hopes that she can get more yields from her rice farm, so she can get more income to update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support on her rice farming to increase her crop yields.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en:
Mukarram is a careful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1967 and is living in village with her family. She is married and has three children. For 11 years she has worked as a teacher at secondary school. She is attentive, gentle teacher and famous around her colleagues. She likes her activity and works with pleasure. 

She is now sick and needs medical service to be treated. She appealed to IMON and KIVA asking a loan to be treated at medical clinic. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at medical clinic

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda tiene 65 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos nietos de 15 y 12 años de edad a los que están apoyando en lo que necesitan es una mujer muy emprendedora ella se dedica a la venta productos varios desde hace 15 años junto a su compañero de vida, juntos están sacando adelante sus ingresos económicos.  Erlinda necesita instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda debido a que no cuentan con ese servicio por el momento y desea cambiar parte del techo de su vivienda y el baño ya que se encuentran en mal estado y que no alcanzan a cubrir estos gastos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cable eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corriente aparte de lamina, alambre pines, clavos etc., para poder instalar lo antes mencionado.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and her two grandchildren, ages 15 and 12, whom they are supporting with what they need.  She is a hard-working woman who works selling various products with her partner, for the past 15 years.  Together they are getting ahead financially. 

Erlinda needs to install electricity in her home because she does not currently have this service.  She also wants to replace part of the roof of her home and bathroom, since it is in bad condition.  Since she cannot cover these costs, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to purchase electric cable, a fuse box, outlets, as well as metal sheets, wire pins, nails, etc., in order to install the above mentioned service.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home and repair her roof.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Elvira has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelda is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emelda has a business buying and selling plants in the Philippines. Emelda requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more plants to sell such as flowers.

Emelda has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more plants to sell such as flowers

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 41 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, personal product care, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 21 years now. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.  Rosalina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase paints and other materials for motorcycle maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase paints and other materials for her motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 49 years old and married with two children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

Arlyn has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Arlyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida works hard to support her family. Vida is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, nails, paint, bamboo, etc.

Vida has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Vida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, nails, paint, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 51 years old.

Juliet has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Juliet has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jimi Pearl

texts.en:
Jimi Pearl is 30 years old, single, and has three children who are in school. Jimi Pearl works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, etc.

Jimi Pearl has been in this business for three years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, etc

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en:
Leab lives in a remote area of the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. She is 54 years old and the mother of six children. Nowadays, she does rice farming as the main source of her family income and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She is able to save around 20,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses.

Her crops having been destroyed by insect pests is the main challenge for her farming. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already and has completely repaid the past loans. Previous loans helped her to have enough materials for supporting her farm better than before.

Leab is now leading a group of five members to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland to boost its productivity for higher crop yields. She has high hopes that this loan will help her to grow her rice farm in a timely manner to gain more yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland to boost the productivity of her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elsa is 35 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies.

Elsa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
A residing living in Mondulkiri province, Ratha is 25 years old and a mother of young child. She grows cassava as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She can get income least than before because her cassava grow not well. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. Her past loan makes her family’s living better than before. In a group of six members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to improve her cassava to produce a good yield. She hopes that she can get more income to support her living condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to improve her cassava to produce a good yield.

loans.name: Runa

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Runa is an independent married woman from a small village in Kandi in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. She is a mother of four children (one son and three daughters). One of her daughters goes to school, one daughter is married and the other daughter stays at home.

Runa’s husband is an electrician by profession. Runa run a small tea stall in their local area with the help of her son. She makes tea and sells it to the passersby and to her neighbors. Her tea shop is situated on the main road of the village. So her business is a profitable one. But day by day, her customers are gradually increasing. Thus, she wants to expand her business.

So Runa applied has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She plans to purchase ingredients like tea leaves, sugar, milk, biscuits, snacks and other necessary things for her tea stall. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and household expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She is much thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary ingredients for her existing tea stall.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Tessie is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Tessie has a plant-vending business in the Philippines. Tessie requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more plants to sell such as flowers

Tessie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Tessie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more plants to sell such as flowers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Vilma is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her buy-and-sell coconut wine business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Aner

texts.en:
Aner is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Aner has been in this business for six years. Aner earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Benilda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy  is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Daisy is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

Daisy has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 47 years old and widowed with seven children. With four children in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Alma has been in this business for 19 years. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ella is 47 years old and has  children who are in school.

Ella has a general store business in the Philippines. Ella requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like noodles, canned good, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Ella has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Ella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, canned good, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is thankful for her first very profitable Kiva loan and she will be grateful to receive the second one. Karine lives in Kapan city of Syunik region and here she is running her business already many years; in her own store she sells office and school supplies and also books for school-aged children and smaller children. Karine has a lot of regular customers and such great assortment of stationery that it is just impossible not to find anything you need. 

All the products for her stall Karine buys from Yerevan and from there she brings batches of books, office and school supplies, as well as photo frames and stuffed toys which she transports to Kapan for resale in her store. Karine is not married and she lives with her mother and brother. 

This time again Karine hopes for Kiva support and this time again she wants to refresh the assortment of her store buying new assortment of footballs, interesting books and some toys for small children.

loans.use: to refresh the assortment of her store buying new assortment of footballs, interesting books and some toys for small children

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elma works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed-culturing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy seaweed seedlings for her seaweed-culturing business.

Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This beautiful lady’s name is Anna and she lives with her father in Sevan city of Gegarkunik region. She is 24 years old. Anna is very intelligent and clever young girl, who cares for education very much and as she says the greatest wealth that man can never loose or nobody can steal it from her it is her education and knowledge. 

Anna graduated high school in the United States of America and then returned to Armenian and graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University receiving specialty of Linguist Teacher, Specialist of English Language and Literature. 

For 3 years she worked at the local school as a teacher of English Language and Literature. Anna asks a loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as she must to go to United States of America again since she took part in a program that gives chance of young teachers, to have teaching experience, to be volunteers and to teach students at a college abroad for a year. 

So this loan Anna will use for her travel costs, which will be significant for her and she will be very thankful is Kiva lenders support her.

loans.use: this loan Anna will use for her travel costs, which will be very significant in her teaching experience

loans.name: Santa Ursula Group

texts.en:
Almadelia, standing third from the right in the picture, is a hard-working woman dedicated to agriculture as well as her family. She is a wife and a mother of two, living in a very small house which is also very difficult to get. She is from the small Mexican village of Santa Ursula, where the population is composed of low-income families that live without electricity service through conventional power lines. 

Now Almadelia and her neighbors have decided to have basic lighting and communications devices in their houses by means of third generation solar home systems. Loan is asked to fund those systems which will be paid back with the monthly fee they pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Sabita is a married woman from a small village in Falakata in Alipurduar district. She is illiterate but can sign her name. She lives with her husband Rupeshwar and three children (two sons and a daughter) in their own kachha house (mud and straw made). One of their children is studying in grade nine.

Sabita's husband is a farmer who is a hard worker and a very enterprising man. He works on their small piece of land from dawn to dusk to grow a variety of crops according to the seasonal demand. He sells them in the local market and earns money for their livelihood. Now they decided to grow maize on their land, as it is a beneficial crop and in great demand in the various markets. This crop is full of various nutrition.

Thus, Sabita requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality maize seeds, fertilizers, manure etc., so that her husband can grow good quality maize on their land. Sabita hopes to expand their business to give good financial support to her family and give a better life to their children with the profit from her agribusiness.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase maize seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources for growing maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, and potatoes, among other vegetables, and to invest in chickens to start a new business.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a generous woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1966 and is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has children. She and her husband are working together doing business to ensure their family. 

Recently she found her children sick. Her children need to be treated at a medical clinic quickly. Unfortunately, she has no money to pay medical service and medicines. She asks a loan to pay her children’s medical treatment. She awaits your kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay her children’s medical treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks such as snacks, candies, mineral water, biscuits, tissues, cigarettes, etc and ingredients for cakes

loans.name: Loubna

texts.en:
Loubna is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family, he owns a bakery in his town with the aim to fulfil the family needs and lifestyle. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees what makes her very happy and optimistic and willing to borrow always Kiva loans to continue paying the fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is 42 years old and has nine children. Edisa is married and has six children who are in school.

Edisa is in the agricultural business, farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Edisa requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like plastic, etc.

Edisa has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like plastic, etc.

loans.name: Ereny

texts.en:
Ereny is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling fish and farming rice.

Ereny dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 45 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Estelita would like to save enough to buy farmland.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 36 years old and married with two children. With both of her children in school, Teodora works very hard to provide for them.

Teodora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Teodora has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Teodora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Remedios is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Remedios has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for six years. In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kratie province, Lai is 27 years old and a mother of two children. For her family’s living, she earns income via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. Her rice was flooded by rain so her rice did not grow well. Lai has involved in her rice farm for 3 years and she can save her income about 25,000KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income from her farming to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish for her dried-fish-making business.

Josephine has been in this business for 12 years. Josephine earns more income from fish vending.

She  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Grace is 36 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Mary Grace has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
Mariel is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mariel has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal for 10 years and also earns an income from ambulant vending of fruits and root crops.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khairul

texts.en:
Khairul is a 52-year-old woman from Kandi. She is living with her husband and sons. They are blessed with five grown-up children (two sons and three daughters). Her daughters are married and her two sons are involved in an income-generating job.

Khairul’s husband is a green grocer. He has been doing vegetable vending in the daily market. Khairul helps her husband in this business after managing her household work. She sells vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, eggplant, ladies fingers, chilies, bottle gourd, bitter gourd, pointed gourd etc. He regularly goes to the nearest wholesale market and brings back vegetables in bulk for supply and vending. They earns small monthly income, which is not enough to maintain the family, bear all the household expenses, invest in the business and materialize her dreams. So to get more income by expanding their business, Khairul and her husband plan to purchase more stock of vegetables etc.

She is seeking a loan from Kiva through BJS to fulfill her purpose. By expanding their vegetable business, Khairul wants to increase her income. This increased income will help the family to have a better standard of living.

She would like to thank her lenders who are helping her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase a fresh stock of vegetables for her vegetable vending business.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Chuicomo Sector Inglesia Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) tiene 22 años de edad, es una joven con grandes sueños y metas ella vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá, Maria para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, esta labor lo tiene ella desde hace cuatro años, María a pesar de ser muy joven aún tiene el anhelo para superarse  y para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de verduras y producción de banano, Maria por ser una muchacha con mucho entusiasmo un grupo de personas a confiado en ella para poder juntas solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en una nuevo de negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder construir su casa a la orilla de la carretera para  instalar una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
María (the first on the left in the photo) is 22 years old. She is a young woman with great dreams and goals. She lives with her parents in a community in the department of Sololá. In order to earn income and help her family get ahead, she works at the purchase and sales of traditional clothing, a labor that she has been doing for four years. In spite of being very young, María is eager to succeed; to increase her income, she also works at selling vegetables and in the production of bananas.

Because she is a young woman with a lot of enthusiasm, a group of people with confidence in her have joined together to request a loan that will be used to invest in a new business that buys and sells traditional clothing.

María's greatest dream is to be able to build her house at the side of the highway where she can set up a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive con su hijo es madre soltera, es una mujer muy emprendedora que se ha dedicado al cuidado de su hijo luchando por darle todo lo necesario. Ella gracias a su esfuerzo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas cerca de una institución nacional donde hay mucha afluencia de personas. Ella esta solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en jugos, golosinas, pan, dulces etc. Y mejorar de esta manera las ganancias de su negocio y tener siempre el sustento diario ella espera una respuesta favorable para invertir inmediatamente seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years. She lives with her son, and she is a single mother. She is an enterprising woman, who is dedicated to raising her son and fighting to give him all that he needs. Thanks to her effort, she has a small business selling candy near a national institution where there are many people. 

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in juice, candy, bread, sweets, etc. This will help her improve the earnings from her business and always have enough for her family’s daily needs. She hopes that a favorable response to invest immediately and continue improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in juice, candy, bread, sweets, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet bread, drinks, cookies, candy and soda to fill orders from businesses that he sells to.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 48  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos los cueles se encuentran estudiando. Francisco es un hombre trabajador que gracias a su labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que él  se dedica desde hace un buen tiempo a la crianza y venta de pollos en su lugar de habitación, negocio que logro  gracias a su esfuerzo y el deseo de superación. Francisco con el deseo de vender más e incrementar sus ganancias solicita este crédito en FUSAI para comprar una mayor cantidad de pollos  y a si generar mejores ganancias que le permitan dar a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Francisco is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three school-age children. Francisco is a hard-working man and thanks to his work he has been able to help his family get ahead. For some time he has been working raising and selling chickens from his home, a business that he has made successful with his effort and determination. Francisco wants to grow his business and income even more so he is seeking a loan from FUSAI in order to buy a large quantity chickens and in this way generate greater income that will enable him to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gladys is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gladys has a business buying and selling personal collection items in the Philippines. Gladys requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more personal collection products to sell.

Gladys has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal collection products to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Now she is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, boxes for fish, etc. for her fishing business.

Nancy has been in this business for 15 years. Nancy earns more income from pig fattening.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline, boxes for fish, etc

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elvira has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Elvira has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Ruth has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Zhuzhuna

texts.en:
Zhuzhuna is 49 years old. She lives with her 2 sons in Batumi. Zhuzhuna teaches at local school and gets a monthly income. She owns a flat which needs to be renovated. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for renovating her flat. As the flat is renovated, she will rent it out at a good price and will have stable income. Zhuzhuna awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out for stable income

loans.name: Siramarg

texts.en:
Siramarg is 53 years old and she lives with her husband who is a farmer in Tsovagyugh of Gegahrkunik region. They have a son and a daughter; both of them are married and they live with their families. Siramarg has two higher education degrees and now she works in her second professionas a teacher of chemistry and biology at the local school. 

Siramarg also wants to start giving courses at her house preparing the pupils for the entrance exams or helping them to prepare their lessons and overcome hardships in the learning process. She asks this loan as she wants to buy a computer, accessories for it and also some professional literature which she will use for her courses at the house.

loans.use: to buy a computer, accessories for it and also some professional literature to be used for her courses at her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy general merchandise like salt, curry powder and other household items to sell.

loans.name: Channeat's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Channeat is 35-year-old mother of four children. For her living, she has been growing peppers and works for others for a fee for around 17 years. She is able to save around 25,000 KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. Her crops have been destroyed by insects, which is the problem for her farming. For Channeat, this is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She improved her living standard with her past loans.  As the group leader, she will use her new loan portion to buy fertilizer for her pepper farming to boost her yields. She hopes that her business will provide her more income from this loan to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her pepper farm to boost her yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en:
Hajran has successfully built her business of general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR to purchase more stock of grocery items such as grains, sugar, oil along with cleaning products. It will help her to meet customers' demands on time.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items such as grains, sugar, oil along with cleaning products.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es:
Trabajar con los animales es la labor que  realiza todos los días Isaías, para el este trabajo es su mayor fuente de ingresos,  pero ahora con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos trabaja como albañil, Isaías cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior él logro comprar los insumos para su granja de pollos y afortunadamente le fue muy bien con el negocio, y ahora sus condiciones de vida han mejorado. El nuevamente solicita un crédito  para poder construir sus gallineros para que sus pollos cuenten con un ambiente mejor  y remodelar su cocina, compra de block, cemento, cal y arena. Isaías espera conseguir este crédito para  hacer posible esta necesidad que él tiene con sus gallineros y su cocina.
El gran sueño de Isaías es poder instalar un negocio de compra y venta de pollo en el centro del mercado de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Isaías works with animals everyday. This work is his main source of income. Now, since he wants to improve his income, he also works in construction. Thanks to his previous loan, Isaías succeeded in buying supplies for his chicken farm, and fortunately, his business is going very well. Now, his quality of life has improved. 

He now requests a loan to build henhouses so that his chickens can have a better environment and to remodel his kitchen, for which he needs to buy blocks, cement, quicklime, and sand. Isaías hopes to get this loan to make possible his needs for the henhouses and his kitchen. 

His biggest dream is to be able to start a business buying and selling chickens in the market in his community.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as blocks, cement, quicklime, and sand.

loans.name: Mbooga Bakyara Tweyombekye Group

texts.en:
Mbogo Bakyara is a community based group committed to improve the livelihood of the people in their community. Its the reason they have mobilised each other to engage in business as well as community development projects. 

Moneda, 35 years is a single mother with 4 children. All her children are in school. She lost her husband four years ago and has struggled through thick and thin to provide for her children and take them school despite the fact that her husband had not left much inheritance.

Moneda comes from Kigusha cell-Mbogo in Kanoni sub county Kiruhura district. She is a small scale farmer and also owns a small retail shop with limited capital where she earns a living to take care of her family. She has applied aloan of ugx1,000,000 to help her add more stock for items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, corn flour, water, soda among other items in her business and also use the rest of the money to pay school fees for her children. 

Her major challenge is limited capital to run both her family and business since she does all these single handedly.
The 12th person on the extreme left seated has a different period so she cannot feature in the group though she signed the waiver form.

loans.use: To boost her retail shop, she will buy stock of daily household and most demanded items for sale

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es: Carlos de 30 años de edad es un hombre que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación, actualmente vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad.  El desde hace un año presta sus servicios en una empresa de textiles en la cual se ha sabido ganar la confianza mostrando su responsabilidad. Carlos desea encementar las paredes y el piso de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en cemento y arena para poder hacer las mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en: 30 year old Carols is a man who always demonstrates a spirit to succeed. Today he lives in his own home with his wife and 2 year old son. A year ago he started working in a textile business where he has gained the confidence of management by showing his responsibility. Carlos wants to cement the walls and floor of his home so he is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement and sand in order to be able to make home improvements.

loans.use: to invest in cement and sand in order to be able to make home improvements.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May works hard to support her family. May is single with one child and has an e-loading station business in the Philippines.

May requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional load wallet to sell.

May has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional load wallet to sell

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
This nice lady, with very nice eyes and charming look, lives with his husband, two children and retired parents-in-law in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Her name is Alla and she has a medical education. Now she works at the psychiatric hospital as a nurse. 

Alla is worried since her mother has some health problems and she is hopeful that Kiva lenders will help her to overcome this problems as quickly as  possible. Alla asks this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams in order to solve her lovely mother’s health problem.

loans.use: to solve her lovely mother’s health problems

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem with his wife, she works as a vocal teacher, daughter and with his parents live in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Artem is a farmer and only through farming he sustains his family’s needs. In his farm Artem has cows, calves, heifers, sheep and chickens. Right from his farm Artem’s parents sell farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat, cheese and eggs. Artem also has hay field which each season brings income to his family as he gathers that hay and sells in his village as a fodder for cattle. 

Now this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams Artem asks, for the purchase of hay mowing machine for his hay gathering activities.

loans.use: to buy a hay mowing machine for his hay gathering activities

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell for her vegetables business.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nizayula Group

texts.en:
The members of the Nizayula group want to have electric light at home, but they live in a remote community of Mexico where the power lines of the national grid do not reach. So they have decided to install third generation solar home systems that include 3 lamps, mobile charging and connection to high-efficient devices. 

Tito is the youngest member of this group, and he wants the system to facilitate the homework and thus the extension of his children’s education beyond the primary school. The loan is asked to fund solar systems for this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una señora de 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo de los dos años, ella vive en una comunidad de Nahualá, para Micela brindarle a su pequeño una buena calidad de vida es muy importante, es por ello que se esmera con dos actividades que son donde provienen sus ingresos, su primera actividad es la compra y venta de abarrotes y la segunda actividad es la producción de café y banano, gracias a estas actividades su familia tiene todo lo necesario, para Micaela aumentar su cultivo es muy importante es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar media cuerda de terreno para cultivo.
Micaela tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para hacer posible la compra de su terreno y algún día construir su casa propia y comprarse un carro.
texts.en: Micaela is a 28 year old single woman with a 2 year old son. She lives in the Nahuala community. Providing a good quality of life for her child is very important to Micaela, so she works two jobs to provide income. Her first job is buying and selling groceries and the second job is growing coffee and banana. Thanks to these jobs her family has everything it needs. In order for Micaela to increase her crops it is important that she has made the decision to seek a loan to be able to buy a plot of land approximately 250 square meters. Micaela has hopes of getting the loan to make her land purchase possible and some day build her own home and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land ~250 square meters to farm

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
With a great deal of drive and perseverance, Thomas wants to set up the pace in his village and become a successful mixed farmer. Thomas resides in the Chebiemit, Kapsowar area of Kenya where poverty is seen in every homestead yet every day when you look at the people living in the area you can see bright people who are eagerly yearning for a golden chance to get out of the poverty conditions that they are in. Armed with this conviction, Thomas has kept hope and has been toiling on his farm for the past 10 years. 

His primary sources of income have been milk, crops and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. The Chebiemit area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a sea of people but the mill keeps breaking down; hence farmers are not able to grind their maize. Thomas intends to change this and is requesting a loan to buy an electric posho mill, which will grind corn or maize into flour. 

Maize meal is very common in Kenya and is a staple food for many communities. Many Kenyan families consume the maize product “Ugali“(hard porridge) regularly. The market usually provides sifted flour, but the cost is higher because of the sifting and packaging. Cheaper flour can be obtained by milling the maize directly using a posho mill. 

Through this loan, Thomas will be able to grind maize faster because he will use an electric posho mill. Cases of breakdown will be long history because electric posho mills are more reliable. This loan will assist Thomas to permanently change his life and achieve his life mission of driving economic development and poverty alleviation in communities in arid and semi-arid areas. Profits from the posho mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan, which Thomas promises to fully repay on time. 

In the next two years, Thomas sees himself as a very established businessman who will be running more than one posho mill in his remote village. Thomas patiently waits for your kindness.
Support this loan to a farmer from the Kenya’s remote area who has great dreams for his family!

loans.use: To buy an electric posho mill to grind cereals

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 58 years old and she lives in Gugark village of Lori region. Karine is a teacher with a higher education. For 25 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of mathematics. She mentions that she likes her work and she also loves her pupils whom she characterizes as very interesting and intelligent children who want to know a lot and they have a lot of questions. Karine also gives paid private curses of mathematics at her house for the pupils who are going to pass entrance exams on the subject of mathematics. Karine is married and she has two children (they are grown up and already married). 

This loan Karine will be happy to have as she wants to buy a computer and also some professional literature as she wants to make her private courses with the pupils more informative and interesting.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some professional literature

loans.name: Karimzhon

texts.en:
Karimzhon is a bright man. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1976 and is living in small town with his family. He is married and has four children. He has 17 years of practice working as a dentist. He has regular clients every day.  

His son is going to university to study dentistry. This year the tuition fee of his studies increased and he had not saved up money to pay his son’s higher education costs at time. He appealed to IMON and KIVA asking financial support to pay his son’s higher education costs. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his son’s higher education costs in dentistry

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 55 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Tessie has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has an e-loading station business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Alicia is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to purchase additional load wallet to sell.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional load wallet to sell

loans.name: Crestita

texts.en:
Crestita is 60 years old and married with two children. 

Crestita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Crestita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Crestita has been raising pigs for three years and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Crestita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leah is 33 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Leah has a hand-weaving business in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for doormat making.

Leah has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for doormat making

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 60 years old and has 10 children. Juana is married and has two children still in school.
