Juana is in the agricultural business, farming banana in the Philippines. Juana requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juana has been in this business for 20 years and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 50 years old and has seven children. Esterlita is married and has one child in school.

Esterlita is in the agricultural business, farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Esterlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like plastic bags, etc.

Esterlita has been in this business for 25 years and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Esterlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Petronia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Petronia works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Petronia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

Petronia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her repair business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.en:
This farmer already once had a chance to have nice partnership with Kiva lenders and he greatly liked it. He lives in the village Geghi of Syunik region and his name is Hrachik. Now he lives alone (his wife died). All his children are already married and they live with their families.

On his farm Harchik has a lot cows, calves, bulls and also chickens. Hrachik sells a lot of meat, milk and eggs from his farm. His orchard is really great and the whole village admires it. Here trees of apple, apricot, plum and cherry which are cutely planted and each season these trees magically color his orchard with sweet and tasty fruits. All his farm products Hrachik sells on his own small track driving in a nearby villages and also he drives to the city. 

Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Harchik asks as he needs to buy hay for his farm cattle and also he must repair the roof of his cattle-barn.

loans.use: to buy hay for his farm cattle and also he must repair the roof of his cattle-barn

loans.name: Ghzala

texts.en:
Ghzala has successfully built her business selling cosmetics with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase more stock of make up kits, lipsticks, cleansers along with facial kits. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of make up kits, lipsticks, cleansers, along with facial kits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a small cart to sell Mexican torta sandwiches and other merchandise.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 30 years old, single and she works hard to help her parents.

Arlene has a general store business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Arlene has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jonalyn is 41 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Jonalyn has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Jonalyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 38 years old and has two children. Riza is married and has two children who are presently in school.

Riza is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

Riza has been in this business for eight years and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is a single woman, 59 years old, with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Diosa has a business buying and selling home products in the Philippines. Diosa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of home products to sell.

Diosa has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of home products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned  goods, soft drinks, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is cheerful young man of 23 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Ashot is not married still. He works at the police station as a policeman. His work does not stop him from being involved in farming and agriculture. On his farm he has cows, a calf, bulls, pigs and chickens. With help of his father Ashot cultivates potato and tomato on his plot of land. His farm products (milk, meat, cheese and eggs, also potato and tomato) Ashot successfully sells from his farm by the help of his mother. Ashot is very prosperous farmer and he thinks of his farm’s enlargement and it development. 

With this loan he wants to buy two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Jayanti. Jayanti lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java, located about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. She is happily married and she owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her stall. Jayanti is a really hardworking person and her community sees her as a trusted mobile provider.
 
As the business grows, Jayanti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile payment to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Jayanti improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services.  Jayanti’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to add more services for her community, if the income capital already good enough to make another business.  

As seen in the photo, Jayanti  is the one who is standing in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Nai Yourn's Group

texts.en:
The farmer who lives in Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province, Nai Yourn is 42 years old and a married mother of a child who is under the school age. In order to support the family’s living, Nai Yourn is working hard on her rice farm to earn income while her husband is working as labor worker in Thailand. She is an industrious woman; sometimes she works for others for a fee in order to supplement the income. She has been involved in her job for 23 years already. 

Now, she decides to apply for new loan for she lacks capital. This is the second time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. For the previous loan, it has helped her to improve her living standard so well. Anyway, currently Nai Yourn can earn only about 28,200KHR a day to sustain family’s living now. She will use her very own loan portion of 500,000KHR to pay for the plowing fees and to buy organic fertilizers for her cash crop, of which the output quantity is expected to increase. She hopefully wants to earn more income to improve her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fees and to buy organic fertilizers for her cash crop, of which the output quantity is expected to increase.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mochsin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Mochsin. Mochsin lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java, located about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. He owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment service for his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity in technology, as well gave more contribution to his community. 
 
As the business grows, Mochsin is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment service to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Mochsin improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services.  Mochsin’s goal towards Ruma in near future is to add more services for his community, if the income capital already good enough to make another business. 

As seen in the photo, Mochsin is the one who is standing in his own stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases  for members of his local community.

loans.name: Sraun

texts.en:
Sraun is a 58-year-old widowed woman living in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family through growing rice for sale. She has been involved in this business for 33 years. The main challenges for her to earn income are that the crops are not growing well and the depreciation of the rice price in the market. 

Sraun has been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for four cycles already and completely paid back the loans. The previous loans helped her to increase funds for growing rice. Her daily income is about 34,000 KHR, which allows her to save about 17,000 KHR each day. Due to having not enough funds to do farming, she is now applying for a new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for labor and the blowing fee to increase her output. She hopes to earn more money through this loan and be able to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor and the blowing fee to increase her output.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Yuyun

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Yuyun, one of Ruma’s agents. Yuyun lives in Surabaya, a city in East Java, located about 2 hours from Jakarta by plane. Yuyun is a young women who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. As a main source of income, She owns and manages a small stall that sell mobile airtime credits. She feels excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. 

Right now, Yuyun is becoming Ruma's agent for 'Mapan', an e-commerce business designed for people in lower communities. By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Yuyun shop. 'Mapan' enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Yuyun and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Yuyun is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Yuyun will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Yuyun believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Yuyun is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchasing products through Ruma's e-commerce for lower communities called Mapan.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a 56 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn a living, she has been engaged in a fishpond business and, with the help of her husband as a driver, provides for their children's daily needs. She needs to increase her income for her children's education needs, so she decided to avail a loan to buy fingerlings for the fishpond so that she can sell more fish in the market and help her family with their food, which will lessen their expenses and generate more income.

Leonita plans for the future to save money to sustain the needs of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fingerlings for her fishpond.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 70 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell tobacco in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of tobacco to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is 44 and she lives with her mother, daughter and retired grandmother in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She works at the restaurant as a cook and also as the assistant to the manager. Naira is very talented and also a woman with great imagination. Free time from her work she takes orders of organizing wedding, birthday and other parties that need nice decoration. She does these works with great pleasure and with good taste so that all her customers like the style and the ways of her decorations. 

Naira asks this loan as she wants to buy a computer through which she wants to look for some new ideas and ways of decoration that will be pleasing  and attractive for her customers.

loans.use: to buy a computer through which she wants to look for some new ideas and ways of decoration

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married male with f1ve children, three of whom are attending school and living in Kasese, Uganda. He has owned a general store for over 10 years now and earns additional income from crop farming. He needs the loan for home improvement to buy building materials such as cement and bricks to fulfill his dream of owning his residential house and complete his house. He faces a challenge of inflation and late payments by his customers.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement and bricks for constructing his residential house.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent(42) has worked in the food industry for over 10years in different levels. "with the experience I have gotten, I am now ready to run my own take away." innocent says confidently.

The father of  2boys and 1 girl is requesting for a Kiva loan to buy equipment such as a chips fryer, deep freezer and a generator to start his own take away shop. 
He has already secured space along a busy intersection and is confident that his business will grow rapidly since there is no other food shop along that street.

He hopes to own a fast food franchise within the next 5years.

loans.use: to buy a fryer, fridge, small generator and food stock for his own fast food restaurant

loans.name: Al Taysir Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the featured borrower for Al Taysir Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Nadia is a 55-year-old married mother of two children. She started, six years ago, preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is well-known among her region and has her own customers. Today, she is acquiring for a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary "Mouneh" raw materials like groats, thyme, Kishk (a fine powder made of a mixture of cracked wheat and yogurt),etc.. to develop her production and satisfy her customers' special requests. 

Nadia is the first lady on the right of the photo, Samira is the second lady on the right, Amena is the second lady on the left, and Fatima is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary "Mouneh" raw materials like groats, thyme, Kishk

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat is a 44 years old farmer living in Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. She has five children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To support her living, she grows cassava in order to earn main income. For her spare time, she works for others for a fee in order to earn additional income. These two businesses earn her decent income and she has been involved in them for ages. Because there is no rain, the crop grows slowly and produces low quality. 

Thus, Yat decides to take out new loan, which will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group of four members, Yat will use her loan of 1,000,000KHR to buy cassava seeds, which is expected to produce more output. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds, which are expected to produce more output.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla, 31, is a farmer who lives in Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province. She is also a married mother of three dependent children who are under age for school. She makes a living growing cassava as the main source of income. Meanwhile, she also grows paddy rice to earn supplemental income for her family. This industrious mother has been involved in her business for ages. Now, she cannot manage to earn good income for her cassava has been destroying by pests. 

Therefore, Phalla decides to apply for a loan of 1,400,000KHR to support her family’s business, and this is the first time of her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of four members group, Phalla will use her loan portion to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of crop. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living condition much better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to increase the productivity of her crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.en:
29-year-old Mirian lives in Kakheti region in eastern Georgia. He is married with one child. In his main job he works as a house painter. And he is a spare-time farmer. At a friend's place, he saw the greenhouse which is shown in the photo. It made him curious and he decided to build his own one in the same design. As a skilled craftsman, he will be able to do the construction work himself.

With the help of the loan, Mirian will buy the necessary iron rods, greenhouse film and drip irrigation system. This irrigation gives the plants only as much water as they need, nothing is wasted. This is important because water is short and precious in the region.

He will be able to grow more vegetables, expand the growing season and protect the plants from storm and hail. He sells the harvest locally

loans.use: to buy iron rods, greenhouse film and a drip irrigation system to build his own greenhouse.

loans.name: Josline

texts.en:
Josline is a married mother of 2 boys. 3months ago, she decided to turn her passion into a business. "I love to bake.I am always making cakes for friends' birthdays or for my sons." she says. 
The 41-year old has been unable to secure employment and has been relying on her husband to take care of the household. 

Following the advice and encouragement of her family and friends, she has now decided to create employment by opening a bakery. She lives in an extremely busy area that is located just outside the CBD, making her business a guaranteed success. With the Kiva loan, Josline will buy baking equipment and set-up a waiting/eating area with a few chairs and tables. 

"Starting this business will give me confidence and i will have more purpose since I will also contribute to my family's expenses." says Josline.

loans.use: to buy a 3 tray oven, 2 cake mixers, chairs and tables and additional equipment for her new bakery

loans.name: Safeela

texts.en:
Safeela  is 50 years old; she is divorced.  

She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es: María de Lourdes tiene 50 años y vive en la Ciudad de México, es una mujer muy ávida y con mucha inquietud por aprender cosas nuevas cada día, desde muy joven ella inició un negocio de marcos y portarretratos, en donde ella decora las fotos, pinturas, dibujos o certificados que los clientes le llevan. Su principal dificultad es la capacidad para anunciarse, lo cual le impide crecer. Por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de  MXN 10,000  para poder invertir en publicidad y además ampliar su muestrario de marcos. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio, volverlo reconocido y de esta forma darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: María de Lourdes is 50 years old and lives in Mexico City. She is an avid woman with a drive to learn new things every day. At a young age she began a photo and artwork framing business, when she worked with photos, paintings, drawings, and certificates that customers brought her. Her main difficulty is the ability to market herself, and this is inhibiting her growth. Therefore she seeks a loan for MXN10,000 in order to invest in publicity and in addition expand her frame display. Her primary dream is to expand her business, have it become well-known, and in this way give the best to her family.

loans.use: to invest in publicity.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Epefania works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Epefania is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc., to sell  for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Epefania has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Puji

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Puji, one of Ruma’s agents. Puji lives in Kediri, a regency located near the Brantas River in the province of East Java on the island of Java. She is happily married and she owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall. She decided to join Ruma because she already knew before that Ruma has the best service and system.

As the business grows, Puji is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Puji improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. 

Puji is the one who is seen in the photo, together with her child. She thanks you for your kind support

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab  is a 33-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband (also shown in the photo) to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. 

She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Zainab  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Currently she has availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat, the farmer living in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, is 36 years old. She is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other one of whom is too young to attend school. 

In order to support her living condition, Sat works a worker in one factory as the main source of income. She also grows paddy rice to earn supplemental income. She has been in this business for about 16 years, and the business has always before earned her good income.

Unfortunately, this year, she is not able to earn any good income as there is inadequate nutrient supply in her farmland. 

Now, she is applying for a loan, which is the first cycle for her, to save her business. She will use her loan to buy a motorcycle for daily commuter and business use, which she believes will decrease the cost of living. She hopes that it will be more convenient to travel from place to place; especially her children can go to school on it.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for daily commuter and business use, which she believes will decrease the cost of living.

loans.name: Kimho

texts.en:
Kimho is a hardworking woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is married and has two children. She works at region’s culture affairs as a librarian. Additionally, she has small store near her house where she sells general products use for everyday life as food products, equipment, etc. 

Her daughter got sick and she is willing to treat her at medical clinic. She requested a loan from KIVA and IMON to treat her daughter in a medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her daughter in medical clinic

loans.name: Zaragul

texts.en:
Zaragul is a responsible woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1964. She is living in small city with her family.  She has no husband or children. She is a teacher at a secondary school. Her previous work was in kindergarten as a tutor. She is an honest and strong person. 

She wants to enter the teacher’s institute to study and get a higher degree for teaching at prestigious institutions. She is striving and working on her self-development and hopes to be a specialist of her major. She requested a loan from Kiva and IMON to pay her higher education costs. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the Kes 55,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kikumbo Mixed Farmers S&c Group

texts.en:
Alice is a married resident of Kyenjojo-Uganda who operates a retail shop in addition to a bar for extra income. She started business in 2000 so as to have different sources of income. Her greatest desires are being financially independent to look after her 5 children and pay school fees for the three who are attending school. She usually complains of price fluctuations of retail products just like other retailers. 

She intends to use the loan to buy beers and sodas to sell in her bar. She is in Kikubo Mixed group where there is member group guarantorship for getting a loan facility.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell in her bar

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a Kiva borrower. She has 8 children. She describes herself to be focused and operates a farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Comerciantes Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay una comunidad cuyos distintivos son los espesos cerros que bordean la gran presa que sirve de principal fuente de trabajo para los habitantes. La mayor parte de la población aún conserva tradiciones y valores de la antigua cultura mazateca ya que lo atesoran como un legado.
   El grupo Comerciantes es originario de dicha región y el nombre hace clara referencia a que todos se dedican al comercio de distintos productos o servicios. Los miembros son: Flor cuya actividad es la venta de tamales; Reynalda, cosméticos; Mauro, pollo mientras que Paula, Andrés y Nazario tienen una carnicería respectivamente. 
   Doña Paula es una mujer destacable pues siempre busca brindar lo mejor a su hijo quien cuenta con 14 años y estudia la educación secundaria. Junto con su esposo Trinidad decidió emprender el negocio de venta de carne de cerdo y sus derivados como la longaniza, la manteca y el chicharrón. Debido a la dedicación puesta en su actividad ahora tienen un negocio fijo sobre la calle principal de su comunidad, así mientras Paula atiende a los clientes directamente en el local, su esposo se encarga de realizar entregas a domicilio. La calidad de su producto habla por sí mismo pues nadie iguala su frescura y sabor aunado del trato amable por parte de los propietarios.
   Este primer préstamo desea invertirlo en la compra de dos cerdos para engorda,  posteriormente tiene en mente criar más ejemplares para incrementar sus ganancias. De igual forma para realizar sin complicaciones su actividad debe adecuar chiqueros para tratar personalmente a cada cría. “Criar cerdos no es tan sencillo pues se deben conocer las necesidades de los mismos, así como tener una limpieza apropiada” comenta refiriéndose a  que debe lavar tres veces al día el corral. 
   Con la oportunidad que VisionFund México nos brinda cada uno de nosotros podrá hacer realidad su más preciado sueño, y de esta manera lograr un mejor bienestar familiar.

*En la fotografía se puede apreciar a los 6 integrantes del grupo, Doña Pau es quien viste blusa roja.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca there is a community whose distinction is the thick hills that border the large dam that serves as the principal source of work for the inhabitants. The majority of the population preserves the traditions and values of the ancient “Mazateca” culture since it is treasured as a legacy.

The group Comerciantes is from this region and the name is a clear reference to them all working in the commercial sector with different products and services.  The members are Flor, whose occupation is the sale of tamales; Reynalda, cosmetics; Mauro, chicken; while Paula, Andres and Nazario respectively have butcher shops. 
   
Dona Paula is a notable woman since she is always looking to provide the best for her child who is 14 years old and in secondary school.  Together with her husband Trinidad, she decided to embark upon the business of selling pig meat and its by-products such as sausage, lard and pork rind.  Due to the dedication they have put into the business, they now have a fixed place of business on the main street of their community.  While Paula takes care of the customers directly in the shop, her husband is in charge of deliveries to homes.  The quality of their product speaks for itself. No one can equal the freshness and flavour, and it is combined with the friendly manner of the proprietors.
 
She wishes to invest this first loan in the purchase of two pigs for fattening.  Afterwards, she has in mind the raising of more in order to increase her earnings. Likewise, in order to accomplish it without complications, she needs to get pigsties to deal with each piglet.  “Raising pigs is not so easy. It is necessary to know what they need as well as to have the appropriate cleanliness,” she says in reference to having to wash the pen three times a day.

With the opportunity that VisionFund Mexico provides each one of us, she will be able to make her most precious dream a reality and in this way achieve improved family well-being.

*In the photograph you can see the 6 members of the group.  Paula is the one wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to buy two pigs

loans.name: Kimsy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer who is living in Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province, Kimsy is 22 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school and other two are under school age. She is growing cassava as the main source of income. She sometimes works for others for a fee in order to earn supplemental income. Now, her eight-year business is in endangered as there are pests that have been destroying her crop. 

Lack of fund to rescue business, Kimsy will apply for a loan, which is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For the previous loan, she has repaid successfully and it has enabled her to improve her living condition better. On behalf of a group of three members, she will use her loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy cassava seeds in order to increase the crop products so that she can earn more income for better support her family. She hopes that she can improve her living standard much better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds in order to increase the crop products so that she can earn more income for better support of her family.

loans.name: Arroyo Venado Group

texts.en:
The members of the Arroyo Venado group are peasants living in a remote community without traditional electricity service in the Mexican State of Oaxaca. They have decided to install third generation solar home systems to have 4 hours of electric lighting daily, mobile charging and connection to some devices. 

Mr. Adolfo, standing fourth from the left in the picture, is a 66-year-old field worker who uses those additional hours of lighting to prepare the products that he collects in the field together with his wife. The loan is asked to fund solar systems for this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar energy systems for their houses.

loans.name: Sukaji

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Sukaji, one of Ruma’s agents. He lives in Kediri, a regency located near the Brantas River in the province of East Java on the island of Java, Indonesia. He is happily married and together with his wife, they have two children (one daughter and one son). Right now, Sukaji is one of Ruma's agent for 'Mapan', an e-commerce business designed for people in lower-income communities.
 
By supporting this loan you will be providing extra working capital for Sukaji's shop. 'Mapan' enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Sukaji, and as their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. 

As a Mapan agent, Sukaji is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Sukaji will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Sukaji believes that his community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices.

Sukaji is the one who is seen in the photo. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchase products through Ruma's e-commerce for lower-income communities called Mapan.

loans.name: Ramon Alcides

texts.es: Don Ramón de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 20 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, maicillo frijol y café, con las ventas que realiza de sus productos agrícolas es como puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, pesticidas, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar su terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder tener un buen cultivo y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Don Ramón, who is 50 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his son. He has worked in agriculture for 20 years. He raises corn, sorghum, beans, and coffee.  He is able to get ahead with the household expenses with the sales that he makes of his agricultural products. He is applying for a loan for the purchase of seeds, compost, pesticides, pest controls, etc. and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph, in order to be able to have a good crop and continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, pesticides, pest controls, etc., and to improve his land.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Rogelio de 43 años de edad, vive en casa de su propiedad a lado de su compañera de vida y de su hijo mayor de edad quien trabaja y ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Rogelio desde hace varios años  se dedica a laborar como jornalero y es así como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Rogelio con motivos de generar y mejorar sus ingresos económicos que le permitan brindar a su familia una mejor condición de vida desea construir una pequeña granja en su casa de habitación para poder dedicarse a la vez a la crianza de pollos que luego piensa vender a un muy buen precio en el mercado central de su municipio, pero debido a que no cuenta con el capital necesario a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de madera, clavos y malla de alambre para la construcción de una granja para pollos.
texts.en: Rogelio, who is 43 years old, lives in a house that is his property at the side of his life companion and their adult son, who works and helps with the household expenses. Rogelio has worked as a day laborer for a number of years, and this is how he has been able to raise his family. With the motives of generating and improving his economic income, which will allow him to offer his family better living conditions, Rogelio wants to build a little chicken farm at his home to be able to also work in raising chickens, which he is then thinking of selling at a very good price in the central market of his town. But due to the fact that he doesn't have the necessary capital, he has made the decision to apply to FUSAI for a loan for the purchase of wood, nails, and wire netting for the construction of a pen for the chickens.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, and wire netting for the construction of a pen for chickens.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: Jose de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, posee un taller de costura desde hace 6 años ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, tiene mucha clientela por el buen trabajo que el realiza, el cliente está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar mas: telas en variedad de estilos, hilos, agujas, botones, entre otras cosas relacionados con la costura para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Jose, who is 62 years old, lives in his own house with his family group. He has had a sewing workshop located in his place of residence for 6 years. He has many customers because of the good work that he does. He is again applying for a loan to purchase more fabric in a variety of styles, thread, needles, and buttons, among other things related to sewing, in order to continue with his work, since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more fabric in a variety of styles, thread, needles, and buttons, among other things.

loans.name: La Fuerza De Carapongo Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA FUERZA DE CARAPONGO” es un grupo conformado por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Maritza tiene 28 años de edad es soltera con 01 hija educando. Ella se dedica hace 02 años a la venta de golosinas gaseosas al por mayor y menor. Años atrás trabajaba como digitadora. El crédito lo invertira en la compra de mas golosinas y gaseosas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maritza es la segunda persona del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: “LA FUERZA DE CARAPONGO” (The Strength of Carapongo) Group is composed of members who are in the retail business. Maritza is 28 years old. She is single and has one daughter in school. She has worked for two years selling sweets and carbonated drinks wholesale and retail. Years ago she used to work as a typesetter. She will invest the loan to buy more sweets and carbonated drinks. The group is grateful to the KIVA lenders for the loan. Maritza is the second person on the left side.

loans.use: to buy more sweets and carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura inicio cultivando hortalizas, ahora también siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como ha podido salir adelante, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como pesticidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus cultivos y así tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Juan is 37 years old. He lives in his own house with his three children. For many years, he has worked in agriculture, growing vegetables. Now, he also grows corn, beans and sorghum. He sells his products in the nearby towns, and he already has established customers. With this he earns his income and has been able to move ahead. Juan is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides, fertilizers, manure, plague controls, etc. in order to continue with his crops, so he can have a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, manure, plague controls, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es madre de familia de 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 8 años, esta humilde familia vive en  una comunidad Sololá.
Manuela para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella tiene dos años de realizar esta labor, Manuela con el afán de mejorar su negocio  a considerado necesario solicitar un préstamo para poder  comprar más mercadería y surtir mejor el negocio y así  llamar la atención de los clientes y también satisfacer mejor las necesidades de ellos.
Manuela tiene las esperanzas puestas en este crédito para poder hacer la inversión y mejorar sus ingresos para luego instalar una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Manuela is the 28-year-old mother of a family. She is married and has a beautiful family of two children between the ages of 2 and 8. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

In order to generate her income and help her husband with the household expenses, Manuela works buying and selling traditional clothing. She has been doing this work for two years. With the desire to improve her business, Manuela has considered it necessary to apply for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and better stock her business and thus attract the attention of the customers and also better satisfy their needs.

Manuela has placed her hopes in this loan to be able to make the investment and improve her income to then set up a shop to buy and sell groceries.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is widowed, has four children and when asked, described herself as focused. For the past three years she has sold fabric to earn a living. She sells in a busy location to individuals looking for material. A lack of capital to develop her business is a real challenge for her.

Irene is taking out a 20,000 KES loan, her first through Kiva's field partner SMEP, to buy more fabric to sell. She is working hard to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize cereals to sell to clients and meet their needs for maize flour.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 61-year-old widowed woman with twelve children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marciana has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Marciana requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to purchase additional fruits to sell in the market like bananas, avocados, watermelons, pineapples, etc.

Marciana has been in this business for 40 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell in the market like bananas, avocados, watermelons, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 35 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are in school. Cherry works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry sells dry goods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to buy dry goods like Tupperware and plasticware to sell.

Cherry has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy dry goods like Tuppeware and plasticware to sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 26-year-old farmer with a great deal of drive and perseverance. He lives in Kiija village situated in the Nkubu area of Kenya, where he has a small piece of farmland where he keeps poultry and grows a wide variety of crops. For the past ten years his primary sources of income have been eggs and produce. Because farmers in the area lack the capital to buy farm inputs such as disease-preventative chemicals, his biggest challenges lie in these areas as well.

Lawrence made a decision to join Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo in order to obtain a loan that would help him improve his farm. He recently applied for a 10,000 KES to expand his operations and increase the farm’s overall output.

Lawrence says any additional income from his farm’s growth will go toward furthering his education and improve his living conditions. With your loan all that Lawrence sees is a brighter future.

loans.use: to develop and expand his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and a married woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Carmen has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, personal care products, and school supplies to sell.

Carmen has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, personal care products, and school supplies.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell animal feed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and rice retailing. Amalia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of animal feed to sell in her stall.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal feed to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eva has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Eva has been in this business for five years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sataran

texts.en:
With the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva, Sataran has successfully built her business doing embroidery. She has become popular in her street for making the best designs. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, sequins, beads, and glittering material for meeting customers' demands on time.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, sequins, beads, and glittering material for meeting customers' demands on time.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell, as well as peanuts and peanut products

loans.name: Amado Antonio

texts.es: Don Amado de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hermana, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado posee mas de 20 años de dedicarse a ese rubro, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, gracias a su trabajo es como el puede salir adelante, Don Amado esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganado de doble propósito y asi seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su fuente de ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Amado, aged 64, lives in his own house with his sister, and he is dedicated to raising cattle. He has been in that line of work for more than 20 years. He sells his products in surrounding towns, and he now has established customers. Thanks to his work, he is able to move forward.

Amado is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle for milk and meat, and thus continue with his work, because that is the source of his income.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for milk and meat.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation) to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell in her salon

loans.name: Yakadi Group

texts.fr: Lassina est celui qui a ses mains sur le Sac de mil. Il fait stockages de céréales, il fait ses achats et ventes : mil, maïs, haricot, arachide dans le marché local. Il est analphabète. Il est veuf et père de quatre enfants en charge, il est âgé de 41ans.  En vue de développer ses activités, il prend le  prêts pour acheter des sacs de cérales.Il beaucoup d’intérêt par mois.  IL a une bonne réputation dans le quartier et au sein de son groupe.
texts.en:
Lassina, age 41, is a widowed father to four dependent children. He is illiterate.

Lassina stores cereals such as millet, maize, beans and groundnuts that he buys and sells at the local market. He is the member holding a sack of millet in the group photo. 

Wanting to expand his activity, he is seeking a loan to buy sacks of cereals. Demand is high every month, and he has a good reputation within his group and around his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her swine as well as fish for her other business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her clothing retail business.

Elsa dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old, married and has four children.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 62 years old and married with five children. 

Virginia is in the agricultural business of farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming sugarcane for 15 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to own a precision seeder

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria tiene la dicha de ser una de las artesanas que elabora hermosos trajes típicos de su región, ella tiene diez años de ejercer esta labor, ella lo hace con el único fin de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia de cuatro hijos de los cuales son de las edades entre 5 y 17 años,  esta familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá. Candelaria es una madre que se preocupa mucho por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar  materiales como block, arena, piedrín, cemento, para la remodelación de su casa.
El gran sueño de candelaria es poder construir otra casa de block para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Candelaria is fortunate to be one of the artisans who create beautiful traditional clothing from her region. She has been practicing this work for ten years. She does this with the sole purpose of obtaining her income and support her family of four children, ages 5 to 17.

This family lives in the community of Nahualá. Candelaria is a mother who cares deeply about her family's well-being. It is for that reason that she has decided to request a loan to buy materials such as cinder block, sand, gravel, and cement, to remodel her house. Candelaria's great dream is to be able to build another house out of cinder block, so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cinder blocks, sand, gravel, and cement.

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr: Balla est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Samako au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 63 ans, Balla est le père de 18 enfants âgés de 4 à 32 ans, dont 16 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture ont incité Balla à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive l'arachide, le maïs, le mil, le sorgho et le riz sur sa parcelle de 15 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de bœufs. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour avoir le courage à plus travailler encore. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide et de sentir moins de fatigue dans le travail. Balla espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir payer le reste du prêt et étendre le champ l'an prochain jusqu'à quatre hectares.
texts.en:
Balla is a farmer signed up with myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Samako, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 63 years old and the father of eighteen children, aged 4 to 32, of whom sixteen have had schooling. 

Farming enables him to ensure his family’s self-sufficiency in food. And he loves farming, thus he has been encouraged to become a farmer. He grows peanuts, corn, millet, sorghum, and rice on his 15-hectare parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of cattle and quality fertilizer.
 
This year, he wanted to purchase a seeder to have the courage to work even harder. Access to the seeder will enable him to be fast and feel less fatigued in his work. With the increase in yields and his revenues, Balla hopes to pay back the loan and expand his field to 4 hectares next year.

loans.use: to own a precision seeder

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary is 42 years old, and one child is still in school.

Mary has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Mary has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. Daisy is married and has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables like eggplant and squash to sell.

Daisy has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like eggplant and squash to sell

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pilar is 51 years old, and has two children who are still in school.

Pilar has a buying and selling of accessories business in the Philippines. Pilar requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted accessories to sell to her customers.

Pilar has been in this business for 17 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 32 years old and has two children. She is married, and her two children are currently in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in this business for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and has five children. Josephine is married, and four of her children are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of farming seaweed in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like plastic, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like plastic, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and single.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 41 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of diesel oil business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional container of diesel oil to sell.

Elsie has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the diesel oil business for 15 years and also earns an income from a general store.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional container of diesel oil to sell

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 30 years old and has three children. Kristine is married, and two of her children are in school.

Kristine is in the agricultural business of farming seaweed in the Philippines. Kristine requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like plastic bags and other supplies.

Kristine has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Kristine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like plastic bags and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corrugated metal, wood and nails to improve the laundry area.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 44 years old and has five children. She is married, and three of her children are in school.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business of farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for 11 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 59 years old and has seven children. She is a married woman.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like plastic bags, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to  buy materials needed for her seaweed farming business like plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and wire in order to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married. Maricel works very hard to provide for the family.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maricel has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Gemalyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision drill seeder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in clothing, sheets and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sheeting, wood and nails to improve the covered walkway of her home.

loans.name: Dina Sarai

texts.es: Dina de 35 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 18, 13 y  9 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace once años cuenta con un local de venta de ropa, en  el cual tiene diversidad de prendas de vestir tales como: blusas, zapatos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. Además vende cosméticos y calzado para dama en el mismo local. Dina desea reparar el techo de un cuarto de su vivienda el cual  utiliza como cocina y el cual la lámina  se encuentra deteriorada. Para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para hacer la reparación necesaria en su vivienda. Dina anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual ocupo para poder colocar balcones en su vivienda y gracias a ello se siente más segura en su hogar.
texts.en: Dina is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children, aged 18, 13 and  9. They are in school. She is an enterprising woman who for eleven years has had a locale where she sells clothes. She offers a variety of clothing such as blouses, shoes, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. In addition, she sells cosmetics and footwear for women in the same locale. Dina wants to repair the roof on a room in her house which she uses as a kitchen, and the sheeting  has deteriorated. To do that, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting, poles and pins to make the necessary home repairs. Dina asked for a loan previously, which she used to be able to put balconies on her home and thanks to that she feels safer in her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, poles and pins to make necessary home repairs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, 44 years old, hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has 5 dependents; her oldest child is 24 and the youngest is 12.  Evangeline is engaged in a hog raising business. She also sells furniture items such as dining tables and chairs. 

Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, pigs and furniture items. This loan would enable her to improve her hog raising business and to sell more furniture to augment her earnings and balance her finances.

Evangeline is thankful for the funds she receives and is determined to expand her livelihood so she can provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, pigs and furniture items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a lodging house and a general store. Josephine is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Aizhan

texts.ru: Айжан, 33 года, в разводе, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Айжан в хозяйстве есть 1,80 Га земельного надела, где выращивает перец, фасоль для реализации. Также занимается торговлей товарами повседневного спроса.  Вся деятельность приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания органической продукции. Доходы от кредита Айжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и хочет накопить на обучение ее детей.
texts.en:
Aizhan is 33 years old, divorced,  and the mother of three. She has received secondary education and is engaged in farm work. Thanks to Aizhan's hard work, she now has a field of 1.8 ha [4.5 acres], where she grows peppers and beans for sale. She also sells staple groceries and household goods. In total, her business brings in about 8,000 soms (KGS) per month. 

In order to develop her business further, Aizhan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers to treat her soil and grow organic produce. Aizhan plans to invest the revenues from her loan in a further expansion of her business. She also would like to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for land cultivation and growing organic products.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita, 28 years old, is married and has five children, one of them in school. Cristita has an agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies.

Cristita has been in this business for 5 years and has previously borrowed once from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Cristita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, bricks and sand in order to cement her dirt floor and also build steps at the entrance to her home.

loans.name: Razela

texts.en: Razela, 42 years old, is married and has five children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 13 years, Razela has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, Razela would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Doña Olivia, es madre soltera, tiene  3 hijos, ella vive junto a un nieto en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Por muchos años a salido adelante vendiendo mercadería, actualmente vende ropa para damas, caballeros y ropa de cama. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Con la institución a solicitado varios prestamos para sostener su negocio, con el prestamo actual que solicita son siete ciclos, el cual es por 5,500 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisas, short y sabanas para aumentar el inventario y vender. Su sueño es crecer como empresaria y que el  negocio sea patrimonio familiar.
texts.en: Doña Olivia is a single mother with 3 children.  She lives with a grandson in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  For many years she has moved forward by selling merchandise.  She currently sells clothing for women and men, and bedding.  She does this work as a street vendor and through orders.   Through the institution [Organización de Desarrollo Empresarial Femenino Financiera, S.A.] she has sought various loans to sustain her business.  The loan she currently seeks will make seven cycles.  The loan is for 5,500 lempiras, and she will invest it in the purchase of of blouses, pants, shirts, shorts and sheets to increase her inventory and sell.  Her dream is to grow as a businesswoman and that the business become a family asset.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, shorts and sheets to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and has four children. She is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Amalia supports her family through her fishing business in the Philippines.

Amalia took out an educational loan for her son, Santiago, 19 years old. The eldest child in the family, Santiago is in his second, and final, year of a Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. Amalia is borrowing PHP 5,000 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016. 

When he graduates, Santiago plans to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en: Ma. Glenda, 50 years old, is a widow with six children. For the past twelve years, she has farmed sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Glenda also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Ma. Glenda works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 6 years, she has operated a business manufacturing hollow blocks in the Philippines. Lily has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials such as cement, sand, etc. to make blocks. In the future, Lily would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, etc. to make hollow blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to change the metal sheets that serve as the walls of his home.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is married with five children and is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.   

Ann supports the family through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

She took an educational loan for her daughter, Victoria Ann, who is 18 years old and is the second of five children in the family. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Education and is currently in the second of this four-year course.

Ann is borrowing 7,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fees of her daughter Victoria Ann for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Victoria Ann plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Jona Mae

texts.en:
Jona Mae is 25 years old and married with one kid who is in school.

Jona Mae is in the agricultural business of farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Jona Mae requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jona Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rabison

texts.en:
Rabison, 35 years old, is married and has three children, all attending school. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Rabison deals in selling secondhand clothes and gets a side income from crop farming, having been in business since 2011. He began his business to create development in his family. Rabison faces a challenge of seasonality whereby his sales increase during the festive season.

Rabison needs a loan to buy building materials, such as iron sheets, for roofing. He has hopes of buying more land and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as iron sheets, for roofing

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy, 51 years old, is married and has six children, one of them in school. Judy has an agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor. 

Judy has been farming sugarcane for three years and has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Judy would like to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en: Remegia, 53 years old, is married and has eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Remegia has operated a food production business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, Remegia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, sugar, beans and other products for her store.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cheryl is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cheryl has a seaweed farming business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies.

Cheryl has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa, 28 years old, is married and has three children, two of them in school. She has an agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. Roquesa has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies.

Roquesa has been in this business for 5 years and has previously borrowed twice from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Roquesa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
