Olivia is married and has five children. She is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. Olivia supports her family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Olivia took out an educational loan for her son, Cesar Christopher, 16 years old. The 3rd of 5 children in the family, Cesar Christopher is in his first year of a 4-year Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. Olivia is borrowing PHP 9,000 to pay for her son's tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Cesar Christopher plans to help his parents earn an income to send his brother and sister to college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bananas and eggs to sell in the street.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a buying and selling of rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Maria has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Vivilita

texts.en:
Vivilita is 40 years old and has four children. Vivilita is married, and two of her children are in school.

Vivilita is in the agricultural business of farming seaweed in the Philippines. Vivilita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other materials needed.

Vivilita has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vivilita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other materials needed

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 37 years old and has two children. Evelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business of farming seaweeds in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies.

Evelyn has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and other supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from meat vending. Gloria is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Sonia Orfa

texts.es: Sonia a sus 37 años de edad a dedicado casi toda su vida a la agricultura, ella vive con su esposo que se dedica a la ganadería y a sembrar pequeños huertos de papas y entre otros productos, Sonia tiene sus dos hijos, el primero asiste a la escuela y el segundo se encuentra en el colegio, el nuevo crédito  que solicita Sonia lo va a invertir nuevamente a su negocio de siembra de papas en la compra de abonos y fungicidas, Sonia se ha caracterizado por ser una persona alegre y positiva, ella manifiesta que le va muy bien en su negocio ya que lo ha venido envidenciando a lo largo del tiempo, su objetivo en la vida es poder incrementar su negocio, que este sea mas rentable para poder brindar a sus hijos el estudio que se merecen y asi poder verlos en un futuro siendo profesionales
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and has dedicated almost her whole life to agriculture. She lives with her husband who works raising livestock and sowing small gardens of potatoes and other products. Sonia has two children, one in primary school and the other in high school.  

Sonia is asking for a new loan and is going to invest it again in her potato-growing business by purchasing fertilizers and fungicides. Sonia has characterized herself as a happy and positive person. She expresses that her business is doing very well as it has proven itself over time. 

Her goal in life is to be able to improve her business so that it is more profitable in order to allow her children to study, as they deserve to, and to see them become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es: María de 48 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos y además es modista actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación, además su esposo emigro al extranjero para tratar de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. María anteriormente obtuvo un crédito el cual utilizo para la construcción de una pila para resguardar agua para el uso y el consumo diario de su hogar y debido a la buena experiencia ella recurre a solicitar un nuevo crédito  a FUSAI para comprar: lámina madera y clavos para reparar el techo y las paredes de la cocina de su vivienda el cual se encuentra en malas condiciones y en épocas de lluvia le presenta filtraciones de agua.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and lives with her family unit. She is a tenacious woman who earns a living offering domestic services and, in addition, works as a dressmaker in her house. In addition, her husband emigrated abroad in order to try to improve his family’s quality of life. 

Maria has received a loan before which she used to construct a basin to collect water for the daily use and consumption of her household. Because of her good experience, she has asked for a new loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof and walls of her kitchen, which are currently in poor condition and cause water leaks in the rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof in the kitchen of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in clothing and meat to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ocote Group

texts.en:
The members of the Ocote group are the heads of the families living in a small village in the Mexican State of Oaxaca. They had no traditional electrification in their houses, and are out of the plans to extend the national grid, so they decided to ask for third generation solar home systems. These systems include 3 led lamps and the possibility of connection to high-efficient electric devices.

Jesus, standing the first from the right in the picture, is one of the Ocote peasants who install a system in their houses to improve the living conditions of their families. The loan is asked to fund those systems and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services.

loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar electric systems for their houses.

loans.name: Nen's Group

texts.en:
Nen, 33, lives with family members in a rural village of the Mondulkiri province and a mother of two schoolchildren. She can earn income to improve her living condition via growing cassava and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her cassava did not grow well and she can sell it in low price. 

For Nen, this is her second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. With her past loan, her family’s living is getting better than before. She leads a group of three members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seed and pay for labor fee to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more yields from her farm so she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor fee to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Zulfnunbi

texts.en:
Zulfnunbi is a joyful woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1960 and is living in small city with her family. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a security man. She has no degree knowledge and that is why she works as a cleaning woman at medical clinic. Their standard of living is satisfactory. 

Her daughter is sick and needs medical service and medicines. She appealed to IMON asking a loan to pay her daughter’s treatment at hospital. She hopes her daughter will be healthy and awaits Kiva lenders support.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s treatment at hospital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be patient, honest. She operates a posho mill where she grinds maize to produce maize flour for sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of maize and rent a storage house. Her business goal is to become a wholesaler of maize  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. 

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize and rent a storage house

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala  has successfully built her business selling crockery with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Her husband (shown in the photo) also assists her by selling in their town.  By the time they have attained good number of customers and make good amount of income to meet their household expenses. 

Previously with the help of Kiva loan she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase variety of crockery items such as bowls, glasses and dinner sets for increasing sales and earning profits.

loans.use: to purchase variety of crockery items such as bowls, glasses and dinner sets for increasing sales and earning profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm equipment as well as cereal seedlings like maize and beans in preparation for planting.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old, and married to Evans. They support four children. 

Beatrice has been a farmer for the last three years earning an income of 4,000 KES per month. She applied her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as maize seeds, fertilizer and a digging hoe to improve her small scale farm for more gain.

Beatrice plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for producing milk to sell to clients and for family use. She hopes to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as maize seeds, fertilizer and a digging hoe to improve her small scale farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 52 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 18 and 28 years. 2 of them go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in a business for 20 years. While her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sweets, toothpaste and other household goods for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. In future, she aims to earn at least 200,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, toothpaste and household goods for sale.

loans.name: Kahenzeka

texts.en:
Kahenzeka is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

Kahenzeka operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions and coconuts. She has been in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Kahenzeka will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and coconuts. She hopes that she will be successful in the future. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and coconuts.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera is a 66-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her 7-year-old grandson in the Khobi district. Venera has two pigs and also owns a plot of land, where she grows maize and nut trees. She is a very hardworking woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest.

Venera wants to expand her husbandry business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for purchasing a cow. She will start producing dairy products to sell and increase her income. Venera awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 42 years old, and married to Jefferson. She supports four children. She has been a farmer for the last three years earning an income of 10,000 KES per month. 

Esther applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as maize seeds, fertilizer and a jembe (digging hoe) to improve her small scale farm for more gain.

Esther plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and buy a dairy cow for producing milk to sell to clients and for family use. She hopes to eradicate poverty and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as maize seeds, fertilizer and a jembe to improve her small scale farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fumigation equipment to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Karen Esmeralda

texts.es: Karen tiene 20 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida, y su abuela de 65 años de edad. Karen es una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de típicos como: yuca frita, tamales y pasteles de verduras con carne en su casa de habitación. De esta forma como Karen se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida quien es albañil mantienen la economía del hogar. Karen anteriormente solicito un crédito para reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda ya que se encontraba deteriorado, con el deseo de ver cada vez más bonita su vivienda solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para con el monto solicitado compra lámina y madera para poder remodelar el cuarto de la cocina la cual posee una lámina la cual está en mal estado y no le brinda mayor seguridad ni protección en tiempos de lluvia.
texts.en:
Karen is 20 years old and lives together with her life partner and her 65 year old grandmother. Karen is an entrepreneurial woman who works making dresses and selling goods out of her home, such as: fried cassava, tamales, and vegetable and meat cakes. In this way, she makes a living and, together with her life partner, who is a construction worker, they take care of household expenses. 

Previously, Karen asked for a loan to repair the deteriorating roof of her humble home. With the desire to see her home become more beautiful, she asks for a new loan from FUSAI to buy sheet metal and wood to be able to remodel her kitchen, which has metal that's in bad shape and is neither safe nor protective in the rain.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to be able to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Didiane

texts.en:
Didiane is 20 years old. She is married with one child who is one year old. Her child does not yet go to school. 

Didiane owns a shop and she has been in business for three years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more Colgate, biscuits and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more Colgate, biscuits and rice to sell.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 52 years old. He is married with five children aged between nine and 19 years old. They all go to school. 

He owns a mini market and he has been in a business for the past five years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as cakes, milk, and biscuits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. In the future, he wishes to own a big supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more items such as cakes, milk and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire gardeners for harvesting and selling cocoa to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Armando Bolivar

texts.es: Armando es un  señor que vive en el campo y comenta que desde muy joven se dedica sembrar sus pequeñas huertas de papas y demás productos que se dan en la provincia en la que Armando reside, Armando es padre de familia de sus  7 hijos, Armando junto a su esposa lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Armando solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, abono, fungicidas, pagar el arriendo del terreno en el que va a sembrar y en lo que mas le alcance, Armando comenta que sus 4 hijos menores están estudiando, Armando espera que le siga yendo bien en su negocio, cuidar sus cultivos para tener  buenas cosechas y que le queden buenas ganancias  y asi seguir saliendo adelante con sus hijos asi como lo ha hecho desde que se caso.
texts.en: Armando is a man who lives in the countryside. He states that since very young, he has worked planting his small potato crops and other items produced in the province where he lives. Armando is a father of 7 children, and along with his wife, they struggle to help their children get ahead. Armando is asking for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fungicides, pay for the land rental, as much as he would have enough for. Armando mentioned that his 4 younger children are studying. He hopes that things go well with his business, that he can take care of his crops to have a good harvest and to have good earnings to continue supporting his children get ahead as he has been doing since he got married.

loans.use: To buy manure and fungicides.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a single mother of two children who attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells fried chips in the market and has been doing so for 4 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT - SACCO to buy a bag of charcoal, cooking oil, Irish potatoes, cabbages and beef. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to buy better serving utensils in the future. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, Irish potatoes, cabbages and beef.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is aged 37 years and he supports 2 children. 

He has been a farmer for the last 8 years and the business earns him 12,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops for a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale to clients. 

He plans to use the profit gained to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops for a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale to clients.

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 45 years old. She is married with two children, ages six and nine. They both go to school.

Donathile owns a shop and has been in a business for four years. Her husband is a farmer. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In the future, she aims to earn at least 150,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en: Kenga is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the loan of 70,000 KES to buy a stock of clothes to sell. His business goal is to be the leading supplier of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will improve his living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a single mother of five children. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been doing this for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feed and feeders. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include diseases which affect the quality of her chicks. She would like to build more houses to expand her poultry business. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their timely loans. She resides with the family and they have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and feeders.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is a 46-year old father of 4 who has been working as a brick-layer for over 20 years. He is disciplined and hard working. His wife is unemployed, making him the sole bread winner. 

Philemon has noticed the need for catering services in his community. The area is rapidly growing and with growth comes events such as funerals, birthdays and weddings. He wants to exploit this market and has decided to start a catering business offering a full package. "I will give them tents and chairs and I will bring people to even cook for them". 

The Kiva loan will assist Philemon to buy a 5mx10m tent, 50 party chairs, 2 tables, a 4-plate stove and a jumping castle that is sure to attract attention at children's parties. 

He is popular in his area, known for his kindness. "I hope to employ a lot of guys from here and help them put bread on the table." says a soft-spoken Philemon.

loans.use: to buy a tent, chairs, tables, a 4-plate stove and a jumping castle. a 5m x 10m tent, 50 party chairs, 2 tables, a 4-plate stove and 1 jumping castle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with three children who all attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis and has been for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT - SACCO to buy braids, weaves and hair relaxers. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Deo Kakiiza

texts.en:
Deo is a forty-year-old hardworking single man, a corporate salary earner who also gets extra income from rentals and farming. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a very enterprising man who has ventured in land-buying with great hopes of developing it in the near future. He has a family dream of marrying after laying a good plan for his family. 

Deo is requesting for a loan to buy land to construct hostels in the future.

loans.use: to buy land to construct hostels in the future.

loans.name: Nurina

texts.en:
Nurina is a 25-year-old woman from a small village in Falakata. She has completed her education up to grade four. She is married to Sanab, age 36. They are raising their three daughters with love and care. All her daughters are attending school. They read in grade eight, four and two, respectively.

Nurina's husband is a daily laborer. His income is not sufficient to provide the family with proper financial sustenance. So, for additional income, Nurina runs an animal husbandry where she rears dairy cows. She sells milk in her neighborhood. To generate more income, she wants to purchase another dairy cow. She has chosen this business, as there is a great demand for milk in her local area. More milk will bring in extra income per month, which is a small beginning, but it amounts to a substantial amount at the end of the year. It will be a key step towards Nurina's goal of earning more, saving better, and achieving the financial stability to provide a good future for her daughters.

Thus, Nurina has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase one more dairy cow. She dreams of investing the earnings from the business into further increasing her business and saving money for her daughters’ future.

She gives thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Baba Gupteswar Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Chanchala, the woman standing first from the left, is a 28-year-old married lady from the village of Lepaguda, in the Koraput district of Odisha. She is the featured borrower of Baba Gupteswar SHG-A. She lives with her husband who works as a milkman and incurs all the household expenditures. She has one daughter who is in school. In order to help her husband in meeting the household expenses, Chanchala wants to start cultivating vegetables.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Chanchala will use her portion of the loan to purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides and insecticides, which will help her get a higher yield and productivity. She aspires to save a certain amount from her earnings, which she will further use to purchase a vehicle that will help her transport the harvest to the target markets.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo de 25 años de edad vive con su esposa, su madre y su pequeña hija de 6 años, él es un hombre muy responsable a falta de empleo se las ha ingeniado para sacar adelante a su familia. Él se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mercado de su localidad es con esto que él logra llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y llevar alimento a su hija él sabe que este negocio tiene mucha rentabilidad y quiere invertir  más en este. Es por eso que Ricardo está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar zapatos, camisas, pantalones cortos, calzonetas deportivas, blusas y ropa de niño y así tener más clientes. Espera el apoyo de este crédito para mejorar sus ganancias y seguir dándole una mejor calidad de vida a su hija que es su mayor prioridad.
texts.en: Ricardo, who is 25, lives with his wife, his mother, and his little six-year-old daughter.  He is a very responsible man who despite not having a job has managed to get his family ahead.  He sells used clothing for a living at his neighborhood market, which is how he is able to provide daily support to his household and provide his daughter with food.  He knows that this business is very profitable and he wants to invest more in it.  This is why Ricardo is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy shoes, shirts, shorts, athletic shorts, blouses, and children's clothing so he can have more customers.  He is awaiting the help from this loan to improve his profits and keep giving his daughter a better quality of life, which is his top priority.

loans.use: to buy: shoes, shirts, shorts, athletic shorts, blouses, and children's clothing for his business selling clothing

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a married woman of 29 years. She lives with her husband Sushil and three children (one son and two daughters) in their own small house in a small village in Falakata, Alipurduar district. She received an education up to grade eight. Her son is reading in grade five, one daughter is in grade two and the other daughter is too small to go to school.

Swapna’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. After managing all the household work, Swapna assists her husband in his agricultural works. Now they are thinking of cultivating paddy, which is profitable and in demand in all seasons as it is a staple food of West Bengal. So they have decided to grow paddy in their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they need some financial help. So, Swapna has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

The requested loan amount will help Swapna to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm resources for paddy cultivation. They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. It will greatly help this family to generate more income. She dreams of building a concrete house with the profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy quality seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources for their existing paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Jeniffer Lorena

texts.es: Lorena es madre soltera, ella vela por el bienestar de su hijo, Lorena tiene 19 años y su hijo tiene 2 años, Lorena traja de vendedora en un almacén de ropa y también invierte en la compra de animales menores. Lorena vive en el campo y  es su madre quien ayuda con el cuidado del su hijo mientras Lorena trabaja, Lorena solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos, Lorena lo que mas espera en la vida seguir adelante en su negocio y seguir luchando para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Lorena is a single mother; she looks after the well-being of her son. Lorena is 19 years old and her son is 2 years old. Lorena works as a saleswoman in a clothing store and also invests in the purchase of small animals. Lorena lives in the countryside and it is her mother who helps with taking care of her son while Lorena works.

Lorena is seeking the money of a loan to invest it in the purchase of pigs. What Lorena hopes for most in life is to press on with her business and continue fighting for the well-being of her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Twenty-four-year-old Sunita is a rural housewife from the small village of Falakata in the district of Alipurduar. She lives there with her husband and a kid son who is a preschooler. Sunita and her husband completed their secondary grade education (grade 10).

Sunita's husband is a farmer. To take care of the family's needs, he is extensively engaged in agriculture and in the cultivation of paddy. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family. In order to continue developing their agribusiness in a sustainable way and at the same time cultivate more paddies on their farmland, Sunita needs capital to invest. So she has taken out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan amount to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources.

Sunita dreams this business will enable her to earn extra profit, which will give financial support to her family to fulfill their basic needs and educate her son properly. She dreams of building a concrete house in the future with the profit from her business.

Sunita sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm resources for farming good quality paddies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in the purchase of windows and doors to finish her fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Sukla

texts.en:
Sukla is a very active lady of 24 years. She lives with her husband in the small village of Dakshin Parengerpar in Falakata. She had received education till grade 6 in her childhood. Now she is a homemaker and blessed with two sons who are too small to go to school.

To make a living for the family, Sukla's husband has been farming various crops and vegetables on their own plot of land. He has been doing this for four years, and he is the only breadwinner for the family. He works arduously to get ahead with the great support of Sukla. He sells the produce from his agribusiness to the local markets. This agribusiness supplies them with the necessary finances to provide themselves with clothing, food, medicine, etc. 

Now they want to expand their business by cultivating paddy (rice). Being a staple food, paddy is in great demand in their locality and is widely used in India. So Sukla has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers and agricultural inputs that will help her to have smooth cultivation of this nutritious and profitable crop.

Her goal is to continue increasing the paddy cultivation, strengthening her family's economy and saving money to purchase more farmland in the future for enhancing her agribusiness.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase good quality seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddies.

loans.name: Khukibala

texts.en:
Khukibala is a 40-year-old, rural, hardworking woman. She is married to Bhupen, a 55-year-old farmer. They live in Latapota, a small village of Falakata, in Alipurduar district, West Bengal, India. She has three grown-up sons. 

Khukibala’s husband is a very hard-working man. He and one of their son cultivates on their ancestral land. They mainly grow paddy rice. They think their business goes well because they have a lot of knowledge about its production and always offer quality products. They supply paddy to the nearby market. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Khukibala is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan amount for purchasing fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover the operational costs of quality paddy cultivation. Their goal is to increase their business activity. With this investment, they will be able to have a better production, and with these earnings, they will be able to improve their family’s quality of life.

Khukibala is very thankful for Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase necessary agricultural inputs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Swapna is a woman of courage and strength. She hails from Falakata. She is married to Mangal and blessed with one young daughter. They live in a small village, Jogendrapur, in Alipurduar district.

Swapna's husband works in an oil mill. His income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Swapna runs her own cattle rearing business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she is able to support her family financially. However, this young ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to expand her business by selling more milk, as it has a huge demand in the local area.

So Swapna seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Swapna will be able to reach her goal of constructing a new and better house for her family’s well-being.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 47-year-old housewife from Falakata, living with her husband and three children (two daughters and one son). All of them are students in different grades. Kalpana herself studied up to grade five, so each of her children needs much assistance with their school studies.

Kalpana's husband is a green grocer. He has no time to take a rest because he is struggling over income, due to their poor financial condition. Kalpana is unable to manage the family’s daily needs and bear the educational expenses of her children, due to the increased price of essential commodities nowadays. Her 17-year-old daughter Laxmi is a student in grade 11 (Arts) in Falakata Subash Girls' High School. She is interested in doing a Hotel Management Course in the future. So she needs to prepare herself for this.

For this reason, Kalpana decided to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to bear the educational costs of her daughter. She also wants to use the loan to purchase study materials and pay for the school and private tuition fees for her daughter. Kalpana has a great ambition for her daughter that she will be in a good position with a higher education in upcoming days.

Kalpana and her daughter Laxmi (in the photo) are very happy after getting the loan and are thanking BJS and Kiva heartily.

loans.use: to cover the educational costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Kanika

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Kanika is a rural housewife of a small village, Raychenga, of Falakata. She lives there with her husband, Sanjib, and a son who is now studying in grade 1. Kanika has received education till grade 10 and did not continue further because of her family’s financial issues.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. He grows different crops and vegetables in his farmland and sells the harvest products in the local market. This is the sole source of the family’s income. Kanika also assists her husband in his agribusiness after managing her household work. The couple works hard for their livelihood, but they can hardly cover all the basic necessities of the family. To achieve satisfactory earnings, Kanika decided to grow paddies (rice) in her farmland as it is very in demand and profitable all over India. Paddy is a crop full of nutrition and a staple food in most of the rural areas. So Kanika seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to enhance her agribusiness with the cultivation of paddy.

She will purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm resources for cultivation. She hopes this will enable her to generate more income and profit as well improve her family economy. She dreams to build a concrete house in the future with the profit outcome from her business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Baba Gupteswar Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Mangatini, 27 years old, from Lepaguda village in the Koraput district, is the featured borrower of Baba Gupteswar SHG-B. She lives with her husband, in-laws and one daughter who is in primary school. Mangatini’s husband owns a betel shop to meet the household expenses of the family, but it is not sufficient to fulfill all the essentials of the family. So Mangatini started her tailoring business and has two years of experience in this business.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Mangatini will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials like oil for her sewing machine, thread, needles, blades and scissor for her business, so that she can acquire a larger number of customers by taking a higher amount of orders.

She aspires to purchase a new fully automated sewing machine. This will boost the speed of her work and increase her savings, which she will invest further in her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, needles, blades, scissor, and oil for her sewing business.

loans.name: Chanchala

texts.en:
Chanchala is 40 years old. She lives at Falakata in West Bengal. She lives there with her husband, two sons and one daughter. All of her children are studying in different grades. Chanchala is a homemaker and her husband, Shiben, is a green grocer.

Chanchala's eldest son, 22-year-old Samiran, is a student for a Bachelor of Arts in Falakata College. He is a very moderate student but obtains passing marks in all his regular subjects. Presently, he is a student of B.A. in his second year. He wants to be a teacher and make his career in the teaching sector, so he wants to take admission in B.Ed. coaching center after completion of his graduation. 

His father's income is very low so it is difficult for him to manage the huge costs for Samiran's educations. His father is short of money to pay the fees and purchase the textbooks all together at the same time. Getting a job in the teaching profession is a dream for Samiran, so he does not want to miss this opportunity.

So, Chanchala is requesting for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to help her son to fulfill his dream. She will pay Samiran's tuition fees and purchase books and other necessary materials for him with the loan money. The loan will help a hardworking student not to discontinue his education just because of financial constraints.

Chanchala and Samiran (standing side by side in the photo) convey their gratitude to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay the fees for her son’s education.

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Aron in Kamwenge Uganda used his previous loan to buy mulch and fertilizers. He still deals in the growing and selling of coffee and bananas as his main source of income alongside goat rearing and political leadership to earn him an extra income. This has helped him to  develop himself and educate his children though he is challenged by bad weather conditions plus soil exhaustion. He however hopes to develop himself into a modern and commercial farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy mulch, fertilizers and pesticides for his garden.

loans.use: to buy mulch, fertilizers and pesticides for his garden.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo, 26, is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 4 years. He deals in produce mainly buying and selling maize, beans and rice in Hoima Uganda alongside farming Cassava. He dreams of constructing his permanent house. He is seeking a loan facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: buy more maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Bulurani

texts.en:
Bulurani hails from Falakata. She is 34 years old and the mother of two sons. She and her husband Goutam both are illiterate and can only sign their name. Her main challenge is her children’s education and she is sending her sons to school.

Her husband, who is 35 years old, is a barber by profession. Due to his scant income, he can't bear all the costs of the family. So Bulurani has been running a business selling milk for many years. She started her own business with one dairy cow. Her husband was the only breadwinner at that time. Over the course of time, her sales increased and her income as well. Bulurani sells their milk in her local community. This all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financially.

To further expand her business, Bulurani has applied for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

She thanks her lenders for this financial help.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Baba Gupteswar Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Jamuna, a 24 years young, energetic lady is the featured borrower of Baba Gupteswar SHG-D from the village Lepaguda of Koraput district. She lives with her husband and two children, aged 2 and 4 years respectively. Her husband works as a salesman in a garment shop in Koraput district. Jamuna earns her living by selling fish and dried fish, which she catches from the nearby river. Drying the fish is a way of preserving the fish for future use by drying them in the sun until the water is completely evaporated. Dried fish has a storage life of several years. Dry fish is used in different delicacies as fresh fish is and is very popular in the region.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Jamuna will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a new net and repair her old net so that she can catch more fish, which will fetch her a higher price in the market. She has planned to reinvest her income in her fishing business so that she will be able to serve a larger base of clients, which will add to her income and make her financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a new net and repair her old net in order to catch more fish

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a 20-year-old woman who hails from Falakata in West Bengal. She received education in her young age till grade 5 due to a lack of money. She is married, and her husband is engaged in agricultural activities. Purnima's only son is a student of grade 4.

Their principal occupation is the cultivation of paddy, and they depend upon this to generate income to cover their family’s various basic necessities. The product is sold in their local market. The couple is involved in the daily care and protection of the paddies. To grow them better, Purnima is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) in order to purchase good quality supplies such as fertilizer, compost and good quality paddy seeds. She will use them to provide necessary care for her husband's agribusiness.

Her goals are to be able to increase their production so that each season it will be greater than it had been in the previous one, and to improve her income day by day. She hopes she will be able to save money for their future and to provide a good lifestyle to her son. She dreams to upgrade their house and purchase more farmland with the profit generated.

She thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to cultivate paddy rice.

loans.name: Pabitra

texts.en:
Pabitra lives in the small village of Falakata. She is an energetic and hardworking widow of 49 years. She lost her husband. She has no children. She received an education up to grade eight. She is a woman with a great mind and good soul.

Pabitra is associated with a clothing business. She purchases various ladies garments from the wholesale market and sells them in her locality. She sells clothing like saris, salwar suit pieces, petticoats, blouses etc. She has been working in this business for many years and has long experience in this area of business. Now with the growing demands of her valuable customers, she wants to expand her business.

She would like to renew her assortment of clothing items and with this aim, she requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase a variety of women's clothing. As festival season is knocking at the door, she needs more stock for her customers. She hopes the expansion of her business will earn more profit to provide her with proper financial sustenance. She wants to get ahead with the business for her secure future.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger variety of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Dalimba is the featured borrower of Gayatri SHG-A. She is married and 39 years old. She works selling popular food items in her house, starting at 6:30 p.m. and finishing when the last customer leaves and the food is gone. Her main motivation for continuing in her business is her mother who started the business more than 30 years ago, selling bada, idli, samosa and upma (Odisha's traditional food items); later, she sold a larger variety of popular south Indian foods. Since she was little, Dalimba and her three siblings helped their mother by tending to customers. "I remember when my mother was selling downtown and my older sister was the one who took care of us." Admiration and respect are what Dalimba has for the two role models that she has in her life. Since she was 10 years old, Dalimba has worked selling bada, idli, samosa and upma, using her mother's recipes. She sets up her stand under a roof that they have established and puts out a large table where she prepares the food. 

Dalimba, along with her other group members, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Dalimba uses the earnings she obtains to contribute to the household expenses, and to reinvest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies for her business. Dalimba needs to stock up on more ingredients like chilies, onions, Maida, cream, beans, oil, flour, toothpicks, and gas, as sales increase with the start of the rainy season. She wants to get ready to satisfy the needs of her customers, who come to her to buy because of the good flavors that she has. Every day, Dalimba thanks God for the great family that was given to her, as now her husband is currently helping her out with her business. She also says that she feels very lucky to have her parents and to take care of them, as they did for her early on.

loans.use: to stock more ingredients like onions, chilis, cream, oil, dough, batter and gas for her business

loans.name: Baba Gupteswar Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Kunda, age 43, is the featured borrower of Baba Gupteswar SHG-C. She is from Lepaguda village in Koraput district. Kunda lives with her husband, one daughter and a son. Her husband works as a bus driver. Kunda owns a beauty salon where she serves her customers by doing makeup, waxing, threading, haircuts, pedicures and manicures. The revenue that she generates from her salon is used for meeting the household expenses and the rest of the amount is used for her children's education.

Kunda, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase materials like face packs, cleanser, toner, moisturizer, a dryer and straightener for her salon to attract more customers, resulting in a rise in her income.

She aspires to save a pretty large amount so that she will be able to make her daughter married in a well settled house and give a motorcycle to her son-in-law as a dowry.

loans.use: to purchase face packs, cleanser, toner, moisturizer, a dryer and straightner for her salon.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year old Tara is an enterprising lady and mother of seven children (four sons and three daughters). Her sons are engaged in different professions and her daughters got married. Her husband is a mason by occupation. Tara is illiterate but can sign her name.

She lives with her family in a semi concrete house in Kandi of West Bengal.

Tara runs a puffed rice business. Locally puffed rice is called "muri.". Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very much popular in rural areas. Tara makes puffed rice in her home and supplies them in her neighborhood. Gradually her customers are increasing. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income. But the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate. Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers' demand by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this financial help.

Tara is grateful towards her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice and necessary materials for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Bina Rani

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year old Bina is a rural housewife. She is a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Two of her sons and one daughter are students and read in grade 12, grade 9 and grade 6, respectively, and the smaller one is a toddler. She lives with her husband and children in the small village of Baganbari in Falakata. 

Bina's husband is associated with a small business. Whatever he earns is spent for household expenses. He finds it difficult to maintain the family and at the same time cover their children's educational expenses. He is neither able to pay their fees, nor give them necessary educational articles. Their son Dipta, 18 years old, reads in grade 12 in Falakata High School. He is very attentive to his studies and tries hard to score good marks in examinations with an aim to be a teacher in the future. Bina feels that her son can study better with complete books, other necessary articles, and if all fees are paid on time.

So, Bina is requesting an education loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary study materials, a bicycle to make his journey to school convenient, and to pay school fees and private tutors' fees. The loan will help a bright student not to discontinue his education just because of financial constraints.

Bina and Dipta (as in the photo) are very much grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees, textbooks, stationery and other necessary annual expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, sand, gravel, iron and cement to build a buckler for his well.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia de estado civil casada estudio  hasta el nivel primario, la señora vive en el área rural junto a su esposo en una casa de adobe que carece de servicios básicos. La señora es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabaja día a día para obtener ingresos económicos. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad ya lleva 25 años. Tiene ocho hijos de los cuales actualmente cuatro estudian en la escuela de su comunidad, trabaja junto a su esposo para sustentar la educación, alimentación y desarrollo de ellos. Los productos que obtienen los lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región, los productos principales que siembra son papa, haba, maíz y otros en pequeña cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Julia necesita un préstamo para la compra de insumos porque de esta manera mejorara su producción y la comercialización de sus productos con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is married and has a primary education.  She lives in a rural area with her husband in an adobe house that lacks basic utilities.  She is a very industrious person who works day after day with an optimistic attitud to earn an income.  Her main activity is agriculture which she has been involved in for 25 years.  Four of her eight children currently attend the community school.  Julia and her husband work to provide them with an education, food and development.

The produce she grows is sold at provincial markets in the region and the main crops are potatoes, lima beans, corn and other crops in small quantities for home consumption.

Julia is in need of a loan to buy supplies to improve her production and sales so she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to improve production and sale of her crops to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Hugo Guillermo

texts.es: Hugo es un joven muy positivo que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, al comercio de choclos,  papas entre otros productos  y también es albañil, Hugo vive solo debido a que sus padres viven en un lugar muy alejado de donde le llevan a trabajar en albañilería a Hugo, él tiene 31 años de edad, el crédito va a invertir en la compra de choclos para incrementar su negocio, la aspiración de Hugo es la de crecer su negocio, seguir trabajando y en algún momento comprar una casa para mejorar la calidad de vida y llevarle a vivir a su madre.
texts.en:
Hugo is a very positive young man who raises small animals and sells sweet corn, potatoes and other crops.  He also works as a bricklayer.

Hugo lives alone because his parents live in a very remote area far from his bricklaying activity.  He is 31 years old and plans to use the loan he is requesting to buy sweet corn to increase his business.

Hugo's goal is to expand his business, continue working and at some point buy a house where he can live with his mother and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sweet corn.

loans.name: Balkis

texts.es:
Balkis continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de un horno y una heladera los cuales han incrementado sus ingresos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo inconvenientes. Actualmente su negocio ha mejorado, en cuanto a la calidad del menú y el número de clientes diarios, “teníamos un poco de temor por la respuesta de los clientes, ellos fueron los primeros en apoyarnos y nos visitan a diario para probar nuestras nuevas comidas preparadas en horno…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con numerosos clientes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para continuar con la ampliación de su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Balkis solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para continuar con la ampliación de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Balkis continues with her traditional food business.  She invested the previous loan she received in an oven and ice cream maker which have increased her income.  She was able to pay back the loan on time with no inconveniences.  Her business has improved with regard to the quality of her food and the number of daily customers.  "We were a bit concerned about how customers would respond, but they were the first to support us and visit us daily to try the new baked foods..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that it has many customers and the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy tables and chairs to continue expansion.  This is her second loan through the institution in the year she has been in business.

Balkis is requesting this loan to buy tables and chairs to continue expansion of her business and to improve her son's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs to expand her business and improve her son's quality of life.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is a housewife from Falakata. She is a 35-year-old woman who lives at Falakata, West Bengal. She is a mother of three children (two daughters and one son). Her elder daughter is pursuing her Bachelor's education and her younger daughter and son are in school. Hasina's husband is a mason by profession and his income is inconsistent and not enough to cover all the household costs of a family of five.

Hasina's only son, 16-year-old Asit, studies in grade 12 in Falakata High School. He is a very brilliant and studious boy. If he could have private tuition or coaching, then he would do much better in his final exam. In spite of having a limited education, Hasina pays more attention to her children's education.

Due to a lack of money, Hasina was feeling helpless about managing her son's educational equipment, tuition fees, school fees, etc. She wants the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase books, pens, exercise copies, etc. and to pay all the tuition fees for her son. The loan will also help her to provide private tuition to her son for the subjects he needs. Now, Hasina is quite relaxed about her son's education as BJS and Kiva came forward to help her financially.

Hasina and her son Asit (in the photo) thank BJS and Kiva for this education loan.

loans.use: to bear the educational costs of her son.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María continúa con su actividad de panadería. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de harina por mayor. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio ha crecido, sus clientes se han incrementado y las ventas han mejorado, “mi panadería va creciendo, los clientes son continuos y exigentes, exigen nuevas variedades tradicionales de pan, como pan de maíz y de arroz…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes y ventas contantes, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina amasadora para amasar el pan. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande, ella desea realizar el horneado de variedades de pan tradicional comprando una máquina amasadora. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina amasadora de pan para hornear variedades de pan tradicional por pedido de sus clientes
texts.en:
María is still working in the bakery. The loan that she received was invested into buying wholesale flour. Her repayments on her loan were on time. Now her business has grown, her clients have increased and the sales have improved. "My bakery is growing, the clients are continuous and demanding. They ask for new varieties of traditional bread, such as corn bread and rice bread," she says. The advantage of her business is that she counts on clients and steady sales. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy a kneading machine to knead the bread.

Her dream is to have a big bakery. She wants to bake traditional bread varieties by buying a kneading machine. This is her 2nd loan with the institution in 5 years that she has had this job. For these reasons, María is asking for a loan to buy a bread kneading machine to bake a variety of traditional breads at the request of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a bread kneading machine to bake a variety of traditional breads at the request of her customers.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 42 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia, ellos viven en una comunidad de Nahualá, para Francisco su familia es muy importante y para darles todo lo necesario trabaja como albañil y como agricultor gracias a estas dos actividades obtiene sus ingresos y  mantiene a su familia, Francisco viendo las necesidades de su familia ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar un amueblado para una de las recamaras, pues sus hijos han ido creciendo y con ello sus necesidades, y lo que él quiere es priorizar que su familia tenga mejor comodidad.
El gran sueño de Francisco es terminar la construcción de su casa, y que sus hijos sean grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisco, aged 42, is married and has a beautiful family. They live in the Nahualá district. His family is everything to Francisco, who works hard as a construction-worker and as a farmer to support his family.

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy a set of bedroom furniture, as his children are growing up and their needs are changing and he wants to prioritize his family's comfort. His dreams are to finish building his house, and for his children to grow up to have good jobs.

loans.use: to buy a set of bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Delmy Magaly

texts.es: Delmy de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende una variedad de productos comestibles y no comestibles, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, refrescos, golosinas, aceite, huevos, granos básicos, jabón, detergentes, entre otras cosas y asi poder surtir mas su tienda con productos para atender mejor a sus clientes y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Delmy is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She owns a store located in her home, where she sells a variety of edible and non-edible products. She has a lot of customers, especially her neighbors. She is asking for a loan to buy soups, soft drinks, sweets, oil, eggs, basic grains, soap, detergent, and other things. This way, she can stock her store with products to better serve her customers and thus have greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy soups, soft drinks, sweets, oil, eggs, basic grains, soap, detergent, and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets and pins to continue his home improvements.

loans.name: El Pozo De La Azomada Group

texts.es: Maria, tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a su hija. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, lleva más de 11 años de sacar producción de maíz  para vender en el mercado local. Maria solicita un prestamo en forma grupal para comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de trabajadores para darle buena asistencia al cultivo de maiz y mejorar la producción. Su plan es lograr tener un sistema de riego para tener cultivo en tiempo de verano. El grupo a que pertenece se llama El Pozo de la Azomada, formado por 8 miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y son reconocidos en la comunidad. Solicitan un monto de prestamo total por 24,500 Lempiras para brindar asistencia a los cultivos. En la foto esta María Suyapa, Mario, Marta, Maria Gloria, Lurbin, Maria Mercedes, Juana y Rosa a la derecha.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old. She is a widow and lives in a village municipality of Gracias, Lempira with her daughter. She has always worked in agriculture, and for more than 11 years she has taken the corn production to sell in the local market. Maria is asking for a loan as part of a group to buy fertilizers, manure and to pay the workers to give her good support for growing corn and improve production. Her plan is to have an irrigation system to have crops in the summertime. The group that she belongs to is called "El Pozo de la Azomada". It is formed by 8 members who make a living in agriculture and are recognized in the community. They are asking for a loan amount total of 24,500 Lempiras to provide assistance to the crops. In the photo there is María Suyapa, Mario, Marta, Maria Gloria, Lurbin, Maria Mercedes, Juana and Rosa to the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and to pay the workers to give her good support for growing corn.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Juana se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos para la venta, necesita un préstamo de $500 para comprar nuevos cerdos y para la compra de alimentos para engorde de los mismos, esto con el fin de ofrecer un mejor producto y mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en: Juana works raising and fattening pigs for sale. She is requesting a loan of  $500 to buy new pigs, as well as the feed necessary for fattening them, so that she can offer a better product and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Jacqueline Valeria

texts.es: Valeria es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y con sus 2 hijos de 6 y 9 años de edad que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, ella se dedica la comercialización de verduras y productos alimenticios y a la crianza de animales menores, comenta  Valeria que todo su trabajo y su lucha diaria la hace para bienestar de sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras  para mejorar su negocio y por medio de este que a sus hijos no les haga falta sobre todo los útiles para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Valeria is a single mother, and lives with her parents and her two children, aged 6 and 9, who go to school. She has a business selling vegetables and other foods, as well as raising young animals. Valeria says that she works very hard to support her children and ensure their wellbeing. 

She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables and improve her business. By improving her business, she can make sure her children want for nothing, particularly school supplies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Gulaiym

texts.ru: Гулайым, 28 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Образование среднее, Гулайым очень оптимистичная, она умеет планировать денежные средства и использовать их по назначению. На протяжении 10 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). Гулайым решила увеличить свой бизнес, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. На свои доходы от кредита Гулайым хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Gulaiym is 28 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and is a very optimistic woman. She is able to make wise financial decisions and use her resources as planned.  Gulaiym has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for the past ten years.  She makes a monthly income of 19,000 som (KGS).  She now wants to expand her business and, for this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and resale.  She plans to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood and metal to build a corral, and nails to build a new space for the hens that she sells.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, 40 years old, is living in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the improvement of the family living conditions

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is a thirty-four-year-old married man with three children who lives in Bundibugyo,Uganda. He deals in cocoa buying and selling. He used the previous loan to buy cocoa for resale. He hopes to construct a permanent house. He is affected by seasonality in trading since cocoa is a seasonal harvest product but works hard to maintain his business. He is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florida is 39 years old and has four children who are in school.

Florida has a food vending business in the Philippines. Florida requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Florida has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Florida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Irena

texts.en:
Irene is 37 years old and married with one child who is in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irene has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 51 years old, married with one child.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Marilou has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from frozen food .

Marilou aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessie May

texts.en:
Jessie May is positive that the children of a driver and a small store owner can also obtain a college degree. This goal fuels her to properly manage her variety store and save little by little in order to expand her business and become a wholesaler of rice in their area in Oton, Iloilo. Her husband, Elly, is a driver who also works hard to supply their needs. 

The people in Jessie May's community are quite familiar with each other. When her neighbors ask for credit for her goods, she cannot refuse them because she understands that it’s not always easy to earn money. But long time debts deplete her capital and affect her family’s everyday sustenance.

As of now, she needs additional capital of PhP 40,000 for her business. She will use it to buy additional items for her inventory. It will stabilize her business and improve her profit despite many debtors in her store. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.

Jessie May is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for sale in her variety store

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a rural smallholder crop farmer in Kericho area of Kenya. Also, he does poultry farming for extra food and income.  The key lesson he has taken away from being in crop farming is predicting weather patterns.

Benjamin is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity. Also, he plans to spend a bit of the loan amount to buy more poultry. 
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Benjamin’s chances for a successful harvests.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as improved seeds and fertilizer and also poultry

loans.name: Sokneng's Group

texts.en:
Sokneng, a local resident living in Kratie province, is 39 years old and a mother of three children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via cashew growing and working for others for a fee to get extra income. She has involved this business for 18 years and earns her about 27,400KHR per day. 

For Sokneng, this is her third cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans as well. With her past loan, she can make more income to improve her family condition get better than before. She leads a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cashew farm. She hopes that she can gain more yield to increase her income than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cashew farm.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Being the leading supplier of milk and be able to offer a good education for her children are the goals that motivate Teresia to get up and work hard.Hello, world! Meet Teresia, a mother from Siongiroi, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past five years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet. Teresia is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. 

Of all the activities she involves herself in, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows. Milking her cow makes Teresia very proud, and she feels fulfilled. Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Teresia wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to grow with. 

She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. Teresia has planted Napier grass, so feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used once she acquires the additional dairy cow. The 'exotic' cow she will buy will produce between 10 and 15 litres of milk per day, and this will translate to more income and profits. The profits from milk selling will allow Teresia to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products, such as cream and yoghurt. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a biogas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Teresia dreams of is a secure future for her children. Teresia awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Magret

texts.en:
Magret is a Rwitsuru resident, Nyakahita, Kiruhura district, her major source of income is agricultural where she has concentrated in cow fattening. Margret took a loan of ugx2,000,000 to buy more agricultural inputs like more cows and drugs for them to increase her production in terms of milk production and even fattening them through good feeds. 

Using the loans from UGAFODE, she has been able to send her children to school and expand her agricultural production because she has realized some interests on her first loan. She has kept herself hard working but faced with the challenge of high prices of drugs for the cows, inaccessibility and long drought but she is so greatful for UGAFODE after realizing that her business alone could meet all her financial needs. Margret is hard working and focussed.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like cow drugs to improve milk yield

loans.name: Namory

texts.fr: Namory est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Kenieroba au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 55 ans, Namory est le père de 13 enfants âgés de 2 à 31 ans, dont 11 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Namory à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive l'arachide,le maïs, le sorgho, la courge et le maraîchage sur sa parcelle de 20 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour faire une double tâche en même temps( semis et engrais). L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être plus rapide et le semoir évite le retard dans le semis . Namory espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et Étendre mon champ l'an prochain.
texts.en:
Namory is a farmer who has joined myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Kenieroba in the south west of Bamako in Mali. At 55 years old, Namory is the father of 13 children, aged from two to 31 years old. Eleven of the children are currently in school.
