Namory became a farmer because it is a strong family tradition, it provides a principal source of income and food for the household, and because it also allows him to ensure his family's independence.

Namory grows groundnuts, corn, sorghum, and squash, and also practices market gardening on his 20 hectares of land. He faces difficulties though, as a farmer, such as a lack of rain and quality fertilizer.

This year, he wanted to buy a sowing machine so that he could do two tasks at once (sow the seeds and fertilize). Access to such a machine will allow him to be quicker and avoid planting seeds late.

He hopes with an increase in his yields and income, he will be able to ensure his family's food independence and extend his field next year.

loans.use: to buy a precision sowing machine

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr: Alou est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Moridiambougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 59 ans, Alou est le père de 9 enfants âgés de 2 à 32 ans, dont 8 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Alou à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs et le mil sur sa parcelle de 2.5 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour couvrir le manque de main d'œuvres. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être plus rapide et sentir moins la fatigue. Alou espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et S'il y a eu des excédents, je vends le reste..
texts.en:
Alou is a farmer who has joined myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Moridiambougou, south west of Bamako in Mali. At 59 years old, he is the father of nine children, aged from 2 to 32 years old. Eight of the children are currently in school. 

Alou became a farmer because it is a strong family tradition and because it is a principal source of income and food for his household. He grows corn and millet on his 2.5 hectares of land. He faces challenges as a farmer though, such as a lack of rain and farming supplies.
This year, he wanted to buy a seeding machine to make up for a lack of manual labor. 

Access to this machine will allow him to do his work quicker and be less tired. 

Alou hopes with an increase in his yields and earnings, he will be able to ensure his family's food independence. Any surplus crops will be sold.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear. Antonia is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 36 years old. She lives with her mother and son in Zugdidi. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have hens and a land, where nut trees are grown. Tea has only seasonal income and she decided to start additional business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing clothes to resell. She will purchase clothes from wholesalers and will resell at higher price to generate profit. Tea is very motivated and hopes that the trading business will be profitable.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothes

loans.name: Tefan

texts.en:
Tefan has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 60000 PKR to purchase more stock of grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour and rice. It will help her to meet customers' demands on time.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of grocery items such as grains, sugar, flour and rice

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a farmer who still being unmarried lives with his parents in Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region. Armen is 34 years old. Armen never did any other work than farming. Now in his farm he has cows, calves a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. On his plot of land he also cultivates potato which re-sellers buy from him right from his farm. He also sells his farm’s milk, meat and eggs. 

Armen greatly wants to develop his sheep breeding and he hopes that Kiva loan will help him to realize his plan. This loan of 400.000 Armenian drams he wants to buy two more sheep and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more sheep and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr: Lassine est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Dalakana au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 57 ans, Lassine est le père de 16 enfants âgés de 36 à 11 ans, dont 12 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer ont incité Lassine à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle de 5 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et de semences de qualité . Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour la culture du maïs. L’accès au semoir lui permettra  de cultiver le maïs dans son champs. Lassine espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants  et construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Lassine is a farmer who has joined myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Dalakana, which is southwest of Bamako in Mali. At 57 years old, he is the father of 16 children, aged from 11 to 36 years old. Twelve of the children are currently in school. 

Lassine became a farmer because it is a family tradition, it ensures his family's independence, and because it is a principal source of income and food for his family. He grows corn on his five hectares of land. He faces challenges as a farmer though, such as a lack of rain, farming supplies, and quality seeds.

This year, he wanted to buy a seeding machine to help with his corn farming. Access to this machine will allow him to grow corn on his fields.

Lassine hopes with an increase in yields that his earnings will cover his children's school fees and that he will be able to build his family a house.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 52 y/o, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. Married to Eugene, a driver and has children who are still in school. She manages her household while operating the business. The couple do their best to provide for their children and their everyday needs.

Isabel has been operating her small store for five years already. She values her store for this is where they earn extra to cover her family's needs. She sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells processed meat like "tocino" (sweetened marinated pork) and "longanisa"(Filipino breakfast sausage made from ground pork). Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Although she face the usual struggle of collecting from those who buy on credit she still maintains a positive attitude that God will provide enough for their needs. 

She is humbly asking a loan for Php 30000 to help her sustain and expand her store. She will use the proceeds to buy additional grocery items such as instant noodles, biscuits, bread, eggs, oil, and several packs of processed food such as "tocino" and "longanisa". She is thanking god and you in advance for your good heart as you support her livelihood.

Isabel's simple dream is to improve their shelter and give her children a College Education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay  for grocery items, processed frozen meat to sell.

loans.name: Modibo

texts.fr: Modibo est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Siby au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 39 ans, Modibo est le père de 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 18 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Modibo à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle de 1 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour cultiver le maïs. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide en semis par rapport à l'an passé. Modibo espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants  et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Modibo is a farmer who has joined myAgro. He lives and works in the village of Siby, which is southwest of Bamako in Mali. At 39 years old, he is the father of four children, aged from two to 18 years old. Two of the children are currently in school. 

Modibo became a farmer, because it is a family tradition, it provides a principal source of revenue and food for his household, and because it allows him to ensure his family's self-sufficiency. He grows corn on his one hectare of land. He faces difficulties as a farmer though, such as lack of rain and farming supplies.

This year, he wanted to buy a seeding machine to grow corn. Access to this machine will allow him to do his work more quickly than last year.

Modibo hopes that with an increase in yields and earnings he will be able to cover his children's school fees and ensure the self-sufficiency of his family's food needs.

loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Helen has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Bayron Geovany

texts.es: Bayron, es soltero, tiene 27 años de edad y vive con una hermana en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. Tiene 9 años de cultivar café. Antes solo cultivaba maíz y frijol. El cultivo de café es su fuente de ingresos actualmente el cual lo vende en la misma zona. El prestamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con la institución y es por 20,000 lempiras, para comprar fertilizantes, y limpieza del cultivo de café. Su meta es mantener cultivos en buen estado y seguir cultivando café para aumentar la producción y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Bayron is 27 years old, single and lives with his sister in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has been growing coffee for nine years. He used to grow only maize and beans. Now he makes a living from growing and selling coffee in area. He is asking for his second loan of  20,000 Honduran Lempiras from the institution to buy fertilizers and pay for cleaning up the crop. His goal is to keep his crops in good condition and to keep growing coffee thereby increasing production to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for cleaning up the coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in electric cable, a cool box, power outlets, pipes, taps etc. to start improving her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Costar

texts.en:
Costar is 35 years old. He is married with 4 children who are attending school and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He is a retailer and he has been in that business since 2013 to earn a living. He grows and sells cocoa to supplement the income from his shop. He dreams of expanding his business, however is limited by inadequate capital. 

Costar has asked for a loan to hire a cocoa garden so he can harvest and sell the cocoa.

loans.use: to hire a cocoa garden to harvest and sell cocoa.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and has four children. Arlene is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Arlene has been raising pig for 19 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
An, who is a farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is 61 years old and she is a mother of two children. She struggles for a living by growing cassava which is her main source of income. Meanwhile, she also grows paddy rice to supplement her family’s income. She has been in this job for 43 years already. 

As the pest has destroyed her outputs, An found that it is hard to sell her crop products at good price in the market. An really wants to save her endangered business and expand it, but she lacks capital. Now, she is leading a group of two to request a loan; she will own a portion of 1,000,000 KHR. 

This will be her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a representative, she will use her loan to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients. She hopes to earn more income from her fertile crop to improve her living standards so they become much better than before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hija de 9 años de edad. Ella es una pequeña comerciante quien distribuye productos de belleza por catálogo. Blanca tiene mucho tiempo de contar con este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más por sus productos de buena calidad.   Blanca con el deseo de poder realizar mejoras en su hogar solicito un crédito para poder encentar el piso de la cocina pero debido a que su baño se deterioró tomo la decisión de repararlo e instalar una ducha la cual le es de gran utilidad, con el deseo de realizar su primer objetivo de arreglar el piso Blanca solicita un nuevo que crédito a FUSAI para comprar grava, cemento y arena para en cementar el piso de su vivienda  dado que actualmente es de tierra y en invierno el suelo se humedece lo cual produce incomodidad y condiciones de insalubridad que ponen en riesgo la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 26 years old and lives in her own house together with her husband and their 9 year old daughter. She is a small scale business woman who distributes beauty products via catalogue. Blanca has a lot of experience with this business and already has a lot of clients who prefer her due to her good quality products. 

Blanca, with the wish of being able to making improvements to her home, is asking for a loan to be able to cement the floor of her kitchen. But due to the fact her bath deteriorated, she took the decision to repair it and install a shower which is of great use. 

With the wish of being able to achieve her first objective of fixing the floor, Blanca is asking for a new loan from FUSAI to buy gravel, cement and sand in order to cement the floor of her home. Given that at the moment it is made of soil and in winter the ground humidifies which causes discomfort and unhealthy conditions which put the health of her family at risk .

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement and sand to cement the floor of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to be able to improve her home.

loans.name: Muazam

texts.en:
Muazam is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in a small town with her family. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a cook. She cooks traditional meals at a catering company. She has many years of practice in the sphere of serving people. She has permanent clients in her catering business. 

She works hard to help her parents and also to have a better standard of living. She is an active, nice and cheerful girl. She does her work on time. She has a sick mother. She wants to treat her in hospital. She appealed to IMON asking for a loan to pay for her mother’s treatment at medical clinic. 

She hopes to be understood and awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her mother’s treatment at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Isabelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a motorcycle transport business. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Demer

texts.en:
Demer is 55 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school. Demer works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, coffee, etc.

Demer has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Demer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, coffee.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a candy-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like like peanuts, cooking oil, garlic, sugar, etc for her candy-making business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like like peanuts, cooking oil, garlic, sugar.

loans.name: Mary Nissa

texts.en:
Mary Nissa is 33 years old, married and works hard to help her husband to earn a living.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, She also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.  Mary Nissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Nissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, milk, biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling nipa roofing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Ninfa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell in her nipa roofing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 34 years old and is a married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. She has been doing a business buying and selling animals for many years. 

She earns good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. 

She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 32. He is married to Hyline and he supports one child. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns him KES 16,500 per month. 

He has applied for the first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production so as to meet client needs. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his child. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

Josephine has been pig fattening for 7 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and is married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sardines, soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

Josie has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and feeds.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like biscuits, sardines, soap, noodles to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 55 years old and is married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.  Lorna has borrowed and paid back 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She has been running the charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Karen Mae

texts.en:
Karen Mae is 21 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Karen Mae has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Karen Mae requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, beads, etc. for her business.

Karen Mae has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Karen Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads, beads, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent cocoa gardens for harvesting and selling to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small photovoltaic systems for their houses.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as enterprising. 

She operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a hotel within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn, 40, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Edelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. 

Edelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jellie

texts.en:
Jellie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jellie is 42 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jellie has a meat vending business in the Philippines. Jellie requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell on her meat stall.

Jellie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Jellie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell on her meat stall.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 50 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested an 11,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Riza has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the store for 19 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothes and raising pigs.

Riza aspires to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Agapio

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Agapio, one of the most hardworking men on earth. He is 56 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. He is the proud father of four lovely children. He hails from Kanyakine, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, and to survive you must have tough skin, but Agapio has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 34 years. 

His primary sources of income are poultry, milk and animal farming. Agapio passionately loves farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows. Whenever he is milking his cow, he feels proud. He is content with the farming way of life. His biggest challenge in farming is irrigating his farm. 
He is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes that he will use to pump water from the river to his farm. Irrigation is used to assist in growing agricultural crops, maintaining landscapes, and re-vegetating disturbed soils in dry areas as well as during periods of inadequate rainfall. 

Through this loan, he will be able to double his crop production, and this will translate to more income. Through the extra income from farming, he will be able to support his family and keep up with his rising family expenses. Agapio patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy water pipes and a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products such as baking flour, bread, sodas and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 55 years and he supports two children. 

He has been a carpenter for the last 15 years and the business earns him KES 12,000 per month.

He has applied for the first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase timber for making chairs, tables and other wood materials for sale to clients. 

He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients and to educate his children.
 
His hope is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for making chairs, tables and other wood materials for sale to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sodas for sale to clients who have increased in the region.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman with five children who describes herself as honest. She has been running a clothing shop for 10 years. Her primary customers are individuals and she describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Cecilia will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of clothing. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business further. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, having repaid her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Rickmas

texts.en:
Rickmas is 35 years old, married, and has four children who all go to school. They are living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He is a retailer and he has been in that business since 2013 to earn a living. He grows and sells cocoa to supplement income from his general store. He dreams of expanding his business despite being limited by inadequate capital. 

Rickmas has asked for a loan to buy sugar and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar and soap for selling.

loans.name: Alexina

texts.en:
Alexina is 43 and supports eight children. She has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers for top dressing her crops in order to produce a good harvest. She plans to use the profits she gains to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to educate her children. 

Alexina's hope is to be financially stable and to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is aged 42 years, married to Sabina, and he supports three children.

He has been a carpenter for the last five years and the business earns him KES 18,000 per month. 

He has applied for the first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase timber for making chairs, tables and other wood materials for sale to clients. 

He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients and to educate his children.

His hope is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for making chairs, tables and other wood materials for sale to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood in order to carry out improvements to the bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan vive con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijas de 16, 14, 7 años de edad por quienes lucha día con día para que tengas lo necesario para su desarrollo tanto físico como emocional es un hombre muy responsable y luchador. El presta sus servicios al transporte público como cobrador en uno de los transportes de su municipio de esta forma lleva el alimento diario a su familia. El está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ladrillo, cemento, hierro, arena, grava y chispa. Para construir un muro de retención para evitar deslizamientos de tierra en el terreno cerca de su casa y evitar futuros accidentes con sus hijas la espera el financiamiento del crédito e iniciar con la mejora en su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his life partner and his three daughters aged 16, 14 and 7. He works hard every day so that they have everything they need both for their physical and emotional development. He is a very responsible man and a fighter. He works as a ticket collector on public transport in his area and in this way earns the daily bread for his family. 

Juan is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in brick, concrete, iron, sand, gravel, etc. to build a retaining wall to prevent landslides in the ground near his home and prevent future accidents with his daughters. He is hoping to get the loan to begin repairing his home and to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, concrete, iron, sand, gravel, etc to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pump for the well.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus is aged 32 years, married to Felisters and he supports 1 child. 

He has been a farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns him 7,500 KES per month. 

Nicodemus has applied for a first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase jembes (digging hoes), maize seeds and fertilizers to enable him to practice his agriculture and get a better harvest for family use and the surplus to sell. 
 
He plans to use gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients, and to educate his child.  His hope is to expand his business sector and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase jembes, maize seeds and fertilizers to enable him to practice his agriculture and get a better harvest for family use and the surplus to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new engine to put in his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products such as baking flour, bread, sodas and cooking oil for sale to clients in need of such products daily

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beers and spirits for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un gran hombre es trabajador, disciplinado y muy sincero, él tiene 56 años de edad es casado, tiene un hijo de 16 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como jornalero, el lleva 35 años de ejercer esta labor, Manuel también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa  que se dedica a la venta de atol, Manuel ahora se ve a la necesidad de poder comprar una cuerda de terreno para  tener donde cultivar, porque él no cuenta con suficiente terreno para aumentar su cultivo, aunque una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder realizar la compra por tal razón solicita un crédito.
El gran sueño de Manuel es poder ver a su  hijo graduarse y ser un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Manuel is a great hardworking man, disciplined and very sincere. He is 56 years old and is married. He has a son who is 16 years old. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

Manuel has the intention of earning an income and helping his family to get ahead as a day labourer, he has been doing this work for 35 years. Manuel also has the support of his wife who works selling atol (a cornflour drink). Manuel now sees the necessity of being able to buy a tract of land to cultivate, because he does not have enough land to increase his crop. One of the difficulties he has is that he does not have enough money to make his purchase and so this is why he is asking for a loan.

Manuel's big dream is to see his son graduate and become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a tract of land.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman and has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. 

Eunice has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. Eunice hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar energy systems for their houses.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 28 years old and a single mother of 4 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 so as to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development.

Sarah practices vegetables farming and also does poultry farrming to supplement her income. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more eggs to add stock to her egg selling business. This will enable her satisfy her customers demands for increased income to enable her pay for quality education for her children. 

Sarah is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to add stock to her eggs selling business for increased income to pay for quality education for her children.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Sorn is 43 years old and she has three children, only one of whom is in school. The sources of her family’s living income are from rice farming and grocery items selling for twenty-five years. She can earn income about 38,000KHR per day and she saves around 13,000KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. Her rice has problem of drought is the main challenge for her farming. 

Due to lack of funds, Sorn is now leading a group to apply for the first loan portion via VisionFund to buy rice seed for her farmland in order to increase her crop yields. She hopes her rice fields will be well better than before so as to gain more yields.

loans.use: to buy rice seed for her farmland in order to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is 33 years old and she lives with her sister and father in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Her sister works as an accountant and only her father manages to help Hermine in her farming and agricultural works. Hermine, on her farm, takes care of cows, calves, bulls, sheep and chickens. She also has a cute vegetable garden the harvest of which she uses for her small family needs. From her farm Hermine sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat and eggs. She mentions that she is happy of her farm activities and cattle care in it. 

This loan Hermine asks as she wants to buy two cows for her farm and also some fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two cows for her farm and also some fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water pump for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a freezer for product storage.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 27 years old, married and had a young child. Edna and her spouse are partners in the vegetable selling business. They sell different vegetables and dried fish in the market. She wants to improve her sales, that is why she is asking for a loan of P15,000 as additional revolving capital. 

She will buy dried fish,tomatoes, onions, eggplant and squash to sell. Someday, she hopes to improve her earnings to save fund for education and emergency funds for the family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, tomatoes, onions, eggplant and squash to sell

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is aged 68 years and he supports six children.He has been offering milling services to clients for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 4,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase posho mill spare parts such filters and oil for spares and maintenance so as to enable him continue offering posho mill services to clients. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education.His hope is to expand his business sector and educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase posho mill spare parts such filters and oil for maintenance so as to enable him continue offering posho mill services to clients.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 50 years old with three children. With one child in school, Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, school supplies, and other groceries.

Vicenta has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Glenn Elmer is 21 years old and is 2nd of three children in the family. His mother Merlyn supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Glenn Elmer is studying Associate in Computer Technology and is currently on His 2nd yr. of this 2 yrs.-year course.

Merlyn is borrowing 15000 to pay for tuition fees of the 2nd yr. & 1st semis try.

When he graduates, Glenn Elmer plans to be gainfully employed so she could help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay her son's 2nd year tuition fees in IT

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 44 years old and married with nine children, five of whom in school, Luzvilla works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell firewood in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell.

Luzvilla has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Luzvilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah is a very hard-working man with a big, farmer's heart which has been strengthened by the humility and good judgment which distinguishes her from other smallholder farmers in Kapsowar area of Kenya. She has spent the past five years of her life farming. She sells dairy milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business, to make ends meet. Linah is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in sheep farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. 

Linah wants to take full advantage of sheep farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her sheep business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000, which she will use to buy additional sheep. With your loan, Linah will be able to sell wool and sheep meat (mutton) to her neighbours and nearby markets. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. 

Linah is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Linah dreams of a secure future for her children. Linah awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sheep and thus expand her farming activities so as to pay school fees

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Johana, 31, a young, energetic, hard-working and focused farmer. He hails from the Kitale area which is one of the most backward, rural towns in Kenya. The condition of the village in the town speaks for itself as basic requirements such as clean water and electricity are missing. However, despite these challenges, Johana loves farming. 

Johana practices mixed farming, and through that he has been able to take care of his aging parents. Not everything has been good for this humble and hard-working man. The Kitale area has a ready market for poultry products and eggs, and Johana, being an enterprising person, would want to take advantage of that and make profits. 

That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming. Johana has got enough space on his farm and wants to make use of the space through poultry farming. Other than income from selling eggs and poultry products, poultry will also provide manure to use in his farm, hence the money that could have been used in buying it will be saved. Johana projects that after a few months he will have more income to buy more poultry and also pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry to expand his farming activities

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, biscuits, soap, can goods, eggs, etc. to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, biscuits, soap, can goods, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Hayde works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Hayde is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Hayde has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 63 years old and married with two children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like home product care, school supplies and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like home product care, school supplies and other groceries

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a mother of four children married and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is in business of selling and buying cocoa although she faces a challenge of seasonality of the cocoa that causes price changes. She is a hard working and determined lady and she hopes that through her hard work, she will be able to expand her business through buying of cocoa plantations. 

She intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children and add capital in her cocoa business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children and add capital in her cocoa business.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is a mother of two living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. she owns a coca garden where she gets cocoa to sell to the clients and also has an additional source of income where she sells second hand clothes, this helps her to get income to support her family. She is a hard working lady and has future plans of buying more clothes to sell.

Moreen complains of unfavorable weather conditions which lead to low customer turn up. She would like to use the loan to buy second hand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hadir

texts.en:
Hadir is a 29 year old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her three children, who are still studying. Her husband is an employee in a company and he is the main income source in the family to be able to enhance their way of living. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old, married woman with three children, one children who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sonia has a seaweed cultivating business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

Sonia has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc

loans.name: Ziripa

texts.en:
Ziripa is a 28-year-old married woman with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She buys and sells cocoa in Bundibugyo. She used the previous loan to buy cocoa for resale. Ziripa managed to get good profits out of her business though seasonal factors are her greatest challenge. 

She hopes to expand her business by putting in more capital to increase his profits and now is requesting for a loan to buy more cocoa seeds for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is a mother of five children and two of them are in school, is 52-year-old and she lives in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows beans, raises chicken and sells porridge to support her family’s living condition. Her crop is growing not well and she has many competitive sellers, which is the challenges for her to earn income. 

This is her fourth loan cycle for her with VisionFund and the previous loans help her to have a better level of living and ability to send her children to school. Now, Sina and another member are seeking for a loan 1,400,000KHR for each.  

As the group leader, she is going to use entire loan portion to spend on buying chickens for raising and renovate her chicken’s cage to generate more income. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income so to have ability to send children to school and to upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy chickens for raising and renovate her chicken’s cages to generate more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, su pareja es albañil, no tienen hijos y en su casa viven sus padres.

Reina, tiene venta de tamales de elote y rigüas desde hace 10 años, comenzó a vender con su mamá y luego puso un puesto  de venta  frente a un hospital, a parte de eso también vende frutas; antes se dedicaba a trabajar como empleada domestica en casa de otra personas.- Ahora, su negocio está a 15  minutos de su casa, viaja en bus y comienza a vender desde las 7:30 a.m. a 3:00 p.m.


El préstamo sera invertido para hacerle reparaciones al lugar donde vende los tamales, para poder guardar las cosas que ocupa.

Sus sueños son tener otro lugar para vender.
texts.en:
Reina, 22 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. She is partnered and her partner is a construction worker. They don't have children and her parents live in her house. 

Reina has sold corn tamales and rigüas [corn patties cooked in a banana leaf] for the past 10 years. She began to sell with her mother and later established a food stand in front of a hospital. Apart from this, she also sells fruit. Before, she worked as an domestic worker in other people's homes. Now her business is 15 minutes from her house, she travels by bus and begins to sell from 7:30 am to 3:00 pm.

The loan will be invested to make repairs to the place where she sells the tamales to be able to protect the things that she has.

Her dream is to have another sales space.

loans.use: to repair the retail location where she sells tamales.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es:
Paula, de 56 años de edad, se casó hace algunos años y junto con su esposo han procreado 4 hijos, quienes ya están mayores de edad, solo vive su última hija con ella que está estudiando sexto grado; Paula, creció junto a sus padres y no pudo estudiar debido a que en su época, el país sufría la guerra civil y por miedo a que fuera llevada por algún bando no la enviaron a la escuela, desde entonces trabaja con sus padres en la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijoles.

Paula, desde pequeña creció trabajando en la siembra de granos básicos y desde que se casó siembra hortalizas en pequeña cantidades como lo son: ejotes, pepinos, chiles y tomates, ellos aprendieron a sembrar hortalizas gracias a que una organización que los capacitaron y fue así como emprendió en dicha actividad; también tiene un pequeño estanque de peces, los cuales vende en la comunidad y les ayuda para el consumo con su familia.

Paula, hace pan para vender, cría pollos de engorde y es así como trabaja para ayudar a sus hijos y a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa.- Cuando ella se va a vender verduras a la ciudad, su esposo se queda cuidando y dando de comer a los peces y a los pollos y está pendiente del riego de las hortalizas, pues tiene que ir a poner las mangueras al rio cercano de dónde sacan el agua.- Ella sale en la mañana a vender verduras tres veces a la semana, lleva las verduras en un canasto y por la tarde cuida de sus pollos de engorde.

Paula, solicita el crédito para comprar 150 pollos de engorde, comprar concentrado, vitaminas y minerales, todo esto es necesario para que engorden y seguir trabajando con la venta de pollos de engorde, anteriormente se quedó un poco estancada con su negocio, porque tuvo pérdidas debido a que se le murieron casi todos los pollos.- También, invertirá parte del dinero para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de pepinos que actualmente tiene.

Paula, sueña con seguir trabajando en los diferentes cultivos y crianza de especies menores, para seguir mejorando poco a poco su calidad de vida; además espera mejorar su vivienda y planea hacer una galera con mejores condiciones para sus pollos de engorde, porque la que tiene por el momento es artesanal.
texts.en:
Paula, 56 years old, got married some years ago and with her husband has 4 children, who are now adults. Only the last daughter lives with her, and is in sixth grade. Paula grew up with her parents and couldn't got to school because, at that time, her country suffered from a civil war and due to fear that she would be kidnapped by one of the groups, they did not send her to school. Since then, she worked with her parents in agriculture, growing corn and beans.

Paula, from when she was little, grew up planting basic grains and since she got married, she grows vegetables in small amounts such as green beans, cucumber, chilies, and tomatoes. She learned to plant vegetables thanks to an organization who trained them and this was how she undertook this work. She also has a small pond with fish she sells in the community and they help her feed her family. 

Paula makes bread to sell and raises and fattens chickens, and in this way she works to help her children and her husband with the household income. When she goes to sell her vegetables in the city, her husband stays to take care of and feed the fish and chickens and keep an eye on the irrigation for the vegetables since he has to go put the hoses in the river near where they get water. She goes in the morning to sell vegetables three times a week, she brings the vegetables in a basket and in the afternoon she cares for the fattening chickens. 

Paula asks for the loan to purchase 150 chicks to fatten, purchase concentrated feed, vitamins and minerals. All this is necessary so they fatten and to continue working with selling fattened chickens. Previously, her business was a bit stagnant because she had losses due to nearly all of her chickens dying. Also, she will invest part of the money to purchase fertilizer for the cucumber crop she currently has. 

Paula dreams of continuing to work with the different crops and raising small animals to continue improving her quality of life little by little. In addition, she wants to improve her house and plans to make a chicken coop with better conditions for her fattening chickens because the one she has now is the traditional kind.

loans.use: to purchase 150 chicks to fatten, to purchase concentrated feed, vitamins and minerals.

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.en:
Nozimjon is a hardworking man. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1983 and is living in a small city with his family. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. He is a master finishing and repair and does his work very gently and accurate, with a lot for clients and orders. 

His daughter is sick. He is responsible to take care about his daughter and wants to treat her in medical clinic. He is asking financial support from IMON and Kiva to pay the medical service and medicines for his daughter’s treatment at hospital. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay the medical service and medicines to her daughter’s treatment at hospital

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 54 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soap, toothpaste, soap, noodles, soap, etc. to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Rosalie would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items like soap, toothpaste, soap, noodles, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Corazon dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Silvia Celina

texts.es:
Silvia, de 40 años de edad, es secretaria comercial, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, pero tiene una hija la cual está estudiando en la universidad, en su casa solo vive su hija, su nieto y su mamá.

Silvia, trabaja como cajera en un restaurante de playa desde hace 10 años, decidio trabajar en ese lugar porque de esa manera podia darle a su hija todo lo necesario; para llegar a su trabajo Silvia, viaja en un vehículo que le han proporcionado en su trabajo y su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.

El crédito que está solicitando Silvia, es para pagar una operación que le harán a su hija, ya que está mal de salud y ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para pagar la operación.

El sueño de Silvia, es trabajar mucho para ayudar a su hija económicamente, para que pueda seguir estudiando en la Universidad y que pueda terminar la carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Silvia, 40 years old, is a business secretary, having completed secondary school. She is single, but has a daughter who is a university student. Only her daughter, her grandson and her mother live in her house.

Silvia has worked as a cashier at a restaurant on the beach for the past 10 years. She decided to work in this place because in this way she could give her daughter everything she needs. To get to work, Silvia travels in a vehicle that her work has provided her, and her schedule is 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.

The loan that Silvia is requesting is to pay for an operation that her daughter will have since she is in bad health and she doesn't have enough money to pay for the operation.

Silvia's dream is to work a lot to help her daughter economically so that she can continue studying at university and finish her university degree.

loans.use: to pay for an operation her daughter will have.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another dairy cow, to increase her herd and plan for zero-grazing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and paddy seeds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a pig farmer in Central Kenya. He has been keeping pigs for many years. His biggest challenge is lack of enough room for the pigs. 

Joseph is seeking a loan to construct more pigsties. He will use the money to buy construction materials and pay for labour. 
Through this loan investment, Joseph will create room for more pigs which will eventually lead to more income from pig products.

loans.use: to construct pigsties so as to raise more pigs and increase his income

loans.name: Luis Arnoldo

texts.es:
Luis, de 46 años de edad, es mecánico industrial, estudió hasta octavo grado, debido al bajo nivel económico le fue imposible continuar con sus estudios, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, junto a ella procreó un hijo que está estudiando bachillerato en la comunidad y solamente su esposa e hijo dependen de él.

Luis, es mecánico industrial, además de eso se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposa e hijo le ayudan en estos trabajos para salir adelante, actualmente tiene sembrado maíz y tiene dos vacas y dos novillos que está criando.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar 2 novillos, para incrementar su ganadería y venderlos a un buen precio  cuando estén grandes y gordos.

El sueño de Luis, es mejorar el taller que tiene en la casa, para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 46 years old, is an industrial mechanic. He went to school up to the eighth grade; due to their low economic level it was impossible to continue with his education. He is married, his wife takes care of the household tasks, and with her he has a son who is in secondary school in the community and only his wife and son depend on him.

Luis is an industrial mechanic and, in addition to this, he has worked in agriculture and raising animals for a long time. His wife and son help him with this work to get ahead. Currently he has corn planted and has two cows and two calves that he is raising. 

Luis needs the loan to purchase 2 calves to increase his heard and sell them at a good price when they are big and fat.

Luis's dream is to improve the shop he has in his house, to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 calves.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a dairy farmer from Siongiroi, which is a remote location in the South Rift area of Kenya. He keeps dairy cows for milk and grows maize/corns for consumption and income. 
This year, he wants to go further. He is seeking a loan to buy a grain milling machine that he will use to process cereal grains into flour. Through this loan investment, he will be able to sell his crop produce as a finished product which will fetch a higher price in the market. Also, he will be able to generate income from processing grains for other farmers in the village.

Income generated from this asset will be used by John to repay the loan and improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy a grain mill for his own use and to make income from others

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a hard-working, hard-fighting woman, a person who values her family and mixed farm.She is based in Chebiemit, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is happily married and has a family that depends on her for the basic needs. For the past ten years, she has been involved in mixed farming on her small piece of land. Her major primary sources of income are egg selling, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

She passionately loves poultry farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about poultry farming, her response was “feeding my poultry.” She sells eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and, because of high quality eggs, customers have been streaming into her compound and the demand has been overwhelming. 

To be able to meet the demand, she is requesting a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan, she will buy quality breeds of poultry that have high productivity, and satisfy the demand that is there. The increased income level will be used in improving her living conditions, and she plans on expanding her business to other towns. Other than increased profits, she will also benefit from poultry manure, which will be used in her vegetable garden to increase productivity. Increased profits will make her business flourish, and provide a secure solid education system to her children.

loans.use: To pay for poultry birds to increase her flock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for his crops such as pesticides, manure, and more.

loans.name: Chhuonh's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in Siem Reap province, Chhuonh is 21 years old and a mother of one kid. Because of her family’s living, she grows rice and sells grocery items to get more income. Her rice grows not well and earns her a little income. She has involved her rice farm for 3 years and it earns her about 23,100KHR per day. 

For Chhuonh, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will use her entire loan portion to buy more land and pay for plowing fees on her rice farm. She hopes that her rice farm produce her more yields and earns her with good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more land and pay for plowing fees on her rice farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hayrigul

texts.en:
Hayrigul is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers, is married and has two children. Her husband is an emigrant. About 18 years she does business in domestic market selling and buying kids clothing. She has regular customers and likes her activity. She tries to serve her customers appropriate and gentle. 

She is willing to buy a new assortment of children's clothing. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy this clothing. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for her market stall

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Helen dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 64 years old and married with four children.  

Victoria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Victoria has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs, improved seeds, fertilizer for a good harvest later

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a rural smallholder crop farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. Besides crop farming, Jacob also does dairy farming for extra food and income.  The key lessons he has taken away from being in crop farming are importance of using quality inputs and predicting weather patterns.

Jacob is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs. With the borrowed money, he plans to buy improved seeds and fertilizer to enhance his farm’s productivity.
With your loan, having quality agricultural inputs will increase Jacob’s chances for a successful harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like improved seeds and fertilizer for a successful harvest

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre que ama el campo, desde hace treinta y nueve años trabaja como agricultor, fueron sus padres los cuales le indujeron al trabajo de sembrar y cosechar, los mismos que le heredarían unas tierras para que se abriera paso en la vida. Él ya fue beneficiado con un préstamo de kiva junto a MiCrédito, que le fue un apoyo indispensable, porque pudo sembrar trigo, guardarlo y venderlo en tiempo de escases de este grano, con sus ganancias logro mejorar notablemente su calidad de vida. 
Esta vez ha vuelto a recurrir a Kiva y MiCrédito, mediante un financiamiento que le dé la oportunidad de comprar semillas de frijol, abono, pesticidas y otros productos para sacar adelante la siembra de una parcela de tierra, dadas las condiciones climáticas de su localidad, debe aprovechar para sembrar. En un futuro planea explorar otros negocios, por ejemplo comprar ganado para criarlo y luego vender los productos derivados de la leche.
texts.en:
Francisco is a man who loves the fields. He has been working as a farmer for 39 years. His parents were the ones who induced him to work sowing and reaping, the same ones who would inherit him land so he could make his way in life. He has already been benefitted from a Kiva loan together with MiCrédito, which was an indispensable support, as he can sow wheat, keep it and sell it in the times when there is a lack of this grain. His earnings allowed him to notably increase his quality of life.

He has once again come to Kiva and MiCrédito for a loan that will permit him to buy bean seeds, fertiliser, pesticides and other products, which he will use to sow a parcel of land. Given the climatic conditions in his area, he needs to take advantage of them to sow.

In the future he plans to explore other business ideas, such as buying cattle to raise and then selling milk-derived products.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds, fertiliser, pesticides and other products

loans.name: Neb Laboum De Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
M. ADAMA est responsable du groupe  NEB LABOUM DE TANGHIN. Marié il père de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 08 mois. 02 des enfants  vont à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’agriculture et l’élevage depuis 05 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 02 sacs d’engrais. 
Monsieur veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour s’occuper de sa famille. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Adama is the leader of the Neb Laboum De Tanghin group. Married, he is the father of four children, aged from eight months to 12 years old. Two of the children go to school. He takes care of four people. 

Adama has been farming and raising livestock for five years. He procures his supplies in the surrounding villages. 

With this loan, he plans to buy two sacs of fertilizer. 

Adama wants to use his earnings from the loan to take care of his family. His ambition is to be a major livestock farmer later on.

loans.use: to buy sacs of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, churros, bread, basic grains and more to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Charn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Siem Reap province, Charn is 52 years old and a mother of six dependent children. She earns income to update her living condition via rice cropping and cassava growing. Moreover, she earns extra income via chickens and pigs-raising. The problems with her business are insect destroyed her rice and her pigs got ill. She has involved this business for 40 years and it earns her about 37,000KHR per day.

This is first time for Charn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pay for plowing fee to support on her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to buy more piglets to improve her pigs-raising bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed and pay for plowing fee to support on her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single mother of five children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She is a tailor and has been in this business for several years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy rolls of material for making clothes. She works from home seven days a week . Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. She would like to buy a plot of land. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy rolls of cloth material for making clothes

loans.name: Zebeded

texts.en:
Zebeded is aged 62 years, married to Robinah and he supports six children.He has been a dairy farmer for the last 40 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for the first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients and meet their demands. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and offer medical services to his children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Margelyn

texts.en:
Margelyn is 52 years old and has three children. Margelyn is married and has two children still in school.

Margelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Margelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig.

Margelyn has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija de ocho años que aún está bajo su cuidado y protección, ellas viven en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá. Paulina trabaja todos los días con mucho entusiasmo para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, ella lleva cinco años de ejercer la labor de compra y venta de ropa típica, afortunadamente ella es una mujer con amabilidad, respeto y carisma es por ello que la gente de su comunidad tiene mucha preferencia con ella al momento de comprar ropa, pero ahora Paulina se ve a la necesidad de poder comprar más mercaderías como: blusas, cortes fajas y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los socios.
El gran sueño de Paulina es que algún día pueda contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor su producto, y que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 35-year-old woman, married, has an eight year old daughter who is still under her care and protection. They live in a community in the department of Sololá. Paulina works every day with a lot of enthusiasm to offer her family better living conditions. She has been working for five years purchasing and selling traditional clothing. Luckily, she is a woman with friendliness, respect and charisma and, for this, people in her community prefer her a lot when they purchase clothing. But now Paulina sees the need to be able to purchase more merchandise such as blouses, skirts, and sashes and to better satisfy her customer's needs.

Paulina's great dream is that some day she will be able to have a retail space where she can better show her products, and that her daughter becomes a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase and sell traditional clothing such as blouses, skirts and sashes.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Percy successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Percy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Brigada

texts.en:
Brigada works hard to support her family. Brigada is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Brigada requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Brigada has been in this business for 30 years now.

Brigada would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rumbadera Group

texts.en:
Living without electricity is a situation that the Rumbadera group members have decided to overcome. Eraclio, the smiling man who is sitting third from the left in the picture, is one of this group members that want to install third generation solar home systems to have electric lighting with three lamps and connection to high-efficient small appliances, in their small, isolated and scattered houses. 

The loan is asked to fund solar systems for this group and will be paid back with the monthly fee for first-year-of-operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, milk, flour, soap, and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years.
