He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a supermarket.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is aged 39 years and she supports 5 children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 3 years and the business earns her KES 20,000 per month.
 
She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fencing materials such as wiring nails, wire mesh and posts to protect her crops from being destroyed by livestock.

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fencing materials such as wiring nails, wire mesh and posts to protect her crops from being destroyed by livestock

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, a youthful 30-year-old farmer from Koilot, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. He is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in his village because of his resilience despite personal challenges and his passion to support his family as a primary caregiver. The living conditions in the Kitale area are very tough and you need to have tough skin in order to survive. Edwin has always shown the resilience to beat all odds. 

Because of the hardcore poverty in his village, Edwin started practicing mixed farming and has been doing it for the past 10 years. Edwin's sources of income are a small side hustle business(motorbike business),vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, and one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. 

The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Edwin is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. 

Edwin is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his family. Edwin's dream is to provide a secure future for his children through paying tuition fees for them. Through your loan you will help him realize his dream.
You can be part of Edwin's dream -- make a loan!

loans.use: To buy a motorbike so as to deliver his produce speedily to market

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josianne is 29 years old; she is married with 1 child age of 4 years, who does not yet go to school. She sells charcoal and she has been in this business for the past 7 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal for selling. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy a car for her business. In future, she aims to earn at least 300,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for selling in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biscuits, sugar and other foodstuffs for selling in her shop

loans.name: Toumboibenere Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA est responsable du groupe  TOUMBOIBENERE. Mariée elle est mère de 07 enfants. Le plus est âgé de 26 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois. 05 enfants vont à l’école. Elle à 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait le commerce de bouillie et de galette depuis 24 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de petit-mil et une charrette de bois de chauffe.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne aussi être une grande commerçante et elle compte aussi construire un hangar.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the leader of the Toumboibenere group. Married, she is the mother of seven children, aged from nine months to 26 years old. Five of the children go to school. Fatoumata takes care of seven people.

She has worked selling bouillie [a type of porridge] and galettes for 24 years. She procures her supplies from a local market.

With this loan, she wants to buy five sacs of millet and one load of firewood. 

Fatoumata wants to use her earnings from the loan to expand her business. Her ambition is also to become a major merchant and build a shed.

loans.use: to buy five sacs of millet and one load of firewood

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Fatima works hard to support her family.

She has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Fatima is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming vegetables business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Faliarisoa Lalanirina

texts.fr:
34 ans, mariée à un chauffeur, Faliarisoa Lalanirinaest une mère de famille dynamique et débrouillarde. Elle a quatre enfants âgés entre 2 à 12 ans et dont trois vont actuellement à l'école.
Avant d'exercer son activité actuelle qu'est la vente des blousons et couettes de seconde main depuis le mois de décembre 2014, elle faisait de la vente ambulante des collations. Cette ancienne activité lui demandait plus de sacrifice et de travaille par rapport à celle qu'elle effectue en ce moment, elle trouve la deuxième plus bénéfique et plus intéressante. C'est la raison pour laquelle, elle décidait de changer et en plus ses commis sont partis pour diriger leurs propres affaires. Et elle souhaite la développer et la renforcer.
Actuellement, elle est en phase de finition de sa propre maison, et ceci , grâce aux efforts mutuels des deux époux. C'est une famille très solidaire et ambitieuse dans le bon sens du terme et qui mérite d'être aidée.
texts.en:
Faliarisoa Lalanirinaest is 34 years old, married to a driver, and the mother of a dynamic and resourceful family. She has four children, aged between two and 12 years old. Three of the children are currently in school.

Before she started her business selling second hand jackets and duvets in December 2014, she worked by traveling around selling snacks. This previous work demanded more sacrifice and work compared to this new business, plus she found this new work more beneficial and interesting. For this reason, she decided to [stop selling snacks]. Plus, her assistants had left to start their own businesses.

Faliarisoa Lalanirinaest wishes to develop and strengthen her business. 

Currently, she is in the final stages of building her own house and it is thanks to earnings from her and her husband. This is a family that shares a sense of solidarity and ambition in the good sense of the words and who deserve to be helped.

loans.use: to buy jackets and duvets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soaps, toothpaste and other items for selling

loans.name: Vererande

texts.en:
Veneranda is 44 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 17 years and 5 of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and she has been in a business for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and cassava for sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house. In future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and cassava for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines for making more clothes.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is 37 years old. He is married with 2 children aged 2 and 4 years, who do not yet go to school. He owns a mini market and he has been in a business for the past 10 years. His wife is a business woman. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more items such as cakes, milk and biscuits for selling. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. In future, he wishes to own a big supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more items such as cakes, milk and biscuits for selling in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beers, soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is 49, divorced and financially responsible for 3 daughters and one son. She has a small grocery store project but the income from her project is very low and can't cover her family's basic needs. She dreams of better living conditions and proper education for her children. 

Sanaa is requesting a 4000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as pasta, oil and rice to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as pasta, oil and rice

loans.name: Charline

texts.fr:
46 ans, mariée, Charline est une mère de famille simple mais très attentionnée à l'égard de sa famille. C'est aussi une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde qui ne se contente pas d'une seule source de revenu pour offrir le bien-être surtout à ses deux enfants (12 et 18 ans).
L'époux de Charline est agent de sécurité dans une société privée, et pour l'aider à soutenir la famille, elle exerce deux activités de commerce, à savoir la vente des fruits d'abord et la vente des vêtements fripes ensuite. C'est pour le renforcement de fonds de cette dernière qu'elle demande un crédit. Elle l'a démarré 
 en 2008, tandis que la vente des fruits est son activité depuis son mariage.
Actuellement, la construction de sa propre maison est en cours, donc elle a fortement besoin d'augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
At 46 years old and married, Charline is a mother of a family who are simple but very caring towards each other. She is hardworking and resourceful, and is not content with only one source of income to provide well-being, especially for her two children, who are 12 and 18 years old.

Charline's husband is a security agent in a private company. She herself helps support the family by conducting two businesses--selling fruits and used clothing. It is for strengthening the latter that she is seeking this loan. She launched this second business in 2008, whereas she has been selling fruits since she got married.

Currently, she is in the midst of building her own house. Therefore, she really needs to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy used clothing like pants, jackets, and sweat pants

loans.name: Alcinda

texts.pt:
Senhora Alcina tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais uma esta ainda em sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino secundário, é avicultora e trabalha como caixa numa loja, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, aros de janelas e portas de modo a dar continuidade a construção da sua casa visto que mora nela mais ainda está em construção.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e oficializar o casamento e construir mais aviários para criar frangos em grandes quantidades.
O seu maior desafio é de garantir o sustento escolar do filho até fazer a licenciatura, e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar mora.
texts.en:
Alcina is 38 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three children, one of whom is in secondary school and still under her responsibility. She's a poultry farmer and works as a cashier in a store. She lives with her family in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase cement, window frames and doors so that she can continue building her house. She lives in that house but it's still under construction.
In the future she intends to finish building her house and get officially married. She also wishes to build more aviaries in order to raise chickens in large quantities.
Her biggest challenge is providing her child with an education up to a college degree. Another challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency.

loans.use: to purchase cement, window frames and doors so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items such as cakes, milk and biscuits for sell.

loans.name: Chikudza

texts.en:
Chikudza is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar,rice soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items. His business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years.

loans.use: buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more salt, soap and sugar for sellong

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, soda and toothpaste for sale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 36 year old married man with four children living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in farming but also gets income from carpentry. He used the previous loan to buy land for farming that enabled him to increase his yields and profits at large. 

Alex is a hard working man who is challenged by a high rate of maize milling machine break downs. He requests a loan to buy a new maize milling machine which will reduce on expenditures of mechanical break downs.

loans.use: to buy a maize milling machine

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is from a small village called Parengerpar of Falakata in West Bengal, India. She is 34 years old and the mother of four children (one son and three daughters). All of her children are studying in different grades in the local village school. Her husband is a carpenter by occupation.

Mina has been engaged with animal husbandry for many years. She rears cows and supplies milk to her neighbours and local villagers. Now this business is a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can be able to generate more income. She has decided to purchase one more cow to expand her business.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow that will be help her in terms of getting more milk for her business. She will provide continuous education to her children with the profit from her business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her existing milk selling business.

loans.name: Fawzeya

texts.en:
Fawzeya is 55, married to a farmer and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband was the only breadwinner to the family until Fawzeya started a small grocery store project to help him with the family income. 

She is requesting a 3000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta to generate more income to her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as oil, rice and pasta.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.en: Jose Alejandro works as a software developer. He is married and has two sons aged 18 and 9. He believes in growth through education and his goal is to help his sons get the best education possible and have the desire to keep learning. He is asking for a loan to do some urgent home repairs. He has some water leakages and needs to change a door window, and he needs to carry out some locksmith repairs.

loans.use: to carry out urgent house repairs such as changing a door window and locksmith repairs due to the rainy season

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 32 years old and married to a housewife. He has two sons and a daughter. 

Mahmoud is a motorcycle taxi driver but the income from his job can't cover the family's monthly expenses. Mahmoud is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to start a fattening project as he has some experience in cattle fattening.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and mobile telephones

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es: Don Gumercindo, tiene 65 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de la Iguala, Lempira, junto a su conyugue y dos de sus hijos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura en el cultivo de maíz, frijol y café. Su actividad fuerte es el café, el que vende en grano despulpado y seco en el mercado local. ademas hace viveros para vender y recibe otros ingresos. El está solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo a la Institucion y es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar insumos como abonos,formula para fertilizar la finca de café y poder sacar  mejor cosecha. Su sueño es mantener en buen estado su finca para heredarla a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 65 years old, married, and has five children.  He lives in a village in the municipality of Iguala, Lempira, together with his spouse and two of his children.  He has spent his whole life in agriculture, growing maize, beans, and coffee.  He devotes most of his attention to coffee, which he sells pulped and dried in the local market.  In addition, he prepares nurseries to sell plants and receive other income.  

He is requesting his fourth cycle of loans with the institution for 10,000 lempiras in order to buy inputs such as compost and fertilizer to fertilize his coffee farm and to be able to obtain a better harvest.  His dream is to maintain his farm in good condition in order to pass it on to his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost to fertilize his coffee farm.

loans.name: Janvier

texts.en:
Janvier aged 20 years, he is not yet married. He owns a shop and he has been in business for the past 2 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy soaps and other foods and household items for selling. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. In future, he aims to earn at least 150,000 per month

loans.use: to buy soaps and other foods and household items for sale

loans.name: Itzel Paola

texts.en: Itzel Paola is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her second loan. She repayed the first loan on time. She is now asking for new loan to continue to invest in her business, in which she makes and sells dairy products such as yogurt, cream, cheese and desserts.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make marmalade and dairy products.

loans.name: Salihu

texts.en: Salihu is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and metal plates, and take on additional carvers at his workshop. Salihu has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: "Upon the death of my father, I was sent to live with one of my father's closest friends, a renowned traditional carver to the then Akwamu chief and the people of Akwamu. I worked with him for about 15 years, during which time I learned the styles and techniques of the Ashanti and Akwamu people. My work began to flourish and achieve recognition, and today, I have apprentice carvers working with me to learn the art of carving." "I really cannot do much without your unfailing assistance. I attribute wherever I am now to your care and assistance, and I pray that you continue to support me and my craft." Use the link below to view Salihu's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/3753

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint, and metal plates, and take on additional carvers at his workshop

loans.name: Marie Nadia

texts.fr:
Marie Nadia est mariée et mère de deux petits adorables enfants dont l'un d'eux seulement fréquente l'école actuellement. Elle a 20 ans en ce moment. C'est une couturière de formation complètement dans son énergie et son activité la passionne beaucoup.
Elle emploie deux personnes pour l'aider à coudre. Elle a déjà beaucoup de clients et beaucoup de commandes, et elle voudrait encore promouvoir et favoriser le développement et la diffusion de son affaire. Elle voudrait devenir professionnel sur ce domaine. Elle a beaucoup d'opportunité avec son âge.
texts.en:
Marie Nadia is 20 years old, married, and the mother of two small adorable children, of whom one is currently in school. 

She is trained as a seamstress and she devotes herself to this work which she has a passion for. She employs two other people to help her sew. She already has many clients and many orders, and she would like to continue to promote and encourage the development and reach of her business.

Marie Nadia wishes to become a professional in this area. She has many opportunities at her age.

loans.use: to buy different colored fabrics

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a 46 year old single lady living in Fort Portal Uganda and has a business of running a restaurant and at the same time does farming. She is faced with challenges of competition that hinder expansion of his business.

Besides that, she hopes by working very hard to make sure she constructs a residential house. Vick has asked for a loan to buy food and more tables and chairs for the restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy food and more tables and chairs for the restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Lilian Isolina

texts.es:
Lilian, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está felizmente acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la jardinería en la ciudad y viven juntos con sus 4 hijos en una casa de adobe.

Lilian, aprendió el oficio de la panadería desde que era pequeñita, pues este negocio viene de generación en generación en su familia, sin embargo cuando terminó de estudiar, vivió un tiempo en la capital del país trabajando como cocinera, luego regresó a su cantón y desde entonces ha trabajado en panaderías ajenas y fue hasta hace un año que ha decidido independizarse e iniciar su propia panadería.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos como azúcar, levadura y harina para la elaboración de pan dulce, pues en estos momentos no tiene mucho dinero para cubrir bastantes pedidos que le ha encargado.

Lilian, sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y construir su casa propia, pues donde viven es de una hermana a quien le cuidan el terrreno; también desea tener mayores ingresos para comprar muebles y electrodomésticos para su casa, pues actualmente solo tiene unas hamacas para dormir y un pequeño televisor que les han regalado.
texts.en:
Lilian is 30 years old and is an enterprising woman. She studied up to Grade 7 and is happily in a relationship. Her partner works in gardening in the city and they live together with their four children in an adobe house.

Lilian learned the baking trade when she was small as the business has passed through generation after generation in her family. However when she finished studying she lived for a time in the capital working as a cook. She later returned to her community and worked in other people's bakeries until one year ago when she decided to go out on her own and opened her own bakery.

She needs the loan to buy supplies like sugar, yeast and flour to make her pastries as at this time she doesn't have enough money to fill the number of orders that she has.

Lilian dreams of her business continuing to expand and of building her own house as where they live belongs to a sister and they care for her land. She also wants greater income to buy furniture and appliances for the house as they currently only have some hammocks to sleep on and a small television that was given to them.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sugar, yeast and flour to make pastries.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman is 27 years old and happily married with one wife and 4 children. He has no dependants and two of his children are in school. He is borrowing a loan of UGX1500,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI). He is the principle farmer of a tea, coffee and banana plantation. He works for 10 hours a day, 6 days a week.  He started the business in order to generate income for his family. The purpose of the loan is to buy fertilizer, chemicals and mulches for his plantations. Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. He hopes to own large plantations of tea, coffee and bananas so he can produce more product for sale. He is always faced with the challenge of price fluctuations, banana bacterial wilt and high prices for agricultural inputs. He is a hard working person.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, chemicals and mulches for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is aged 31 and he is still single. He is borrowing a loan of ugx3500,000/= and this is his first time borrowing from UGAFODE Microfinance ltd (MDI). 

He is a mechanic and the purpose of the loan is to buy stocks of spare parts for selling. This will help him to meet the increasing demand for spare parts by the many motorcyclists mushrooming in town. He works for 10 hours a day and 6 days a week.  Most of his clients are people in Bushenyi District. 

He hopes to own several bodabodas. He is always faced with a challenge of capital for the business.  He is a hard working person.

loans.use: To boost his spare parts business

loans.name: Puspa

texts.en:
Puspa is a 34-year-old rural woman. She resides at Jogendrapur, a small village in Falakata of West Bengal. In her childhood, she was deprived of education due to the financial issues in her family. Now she is a housewife and a mother of two sons who are students.

Puspa's husband is a farmer by profession. He cultivates seasonal vegetables and sells the harvest products to the local town market as well as to the wholesalers. Puspa tries to help her husband by every means through a small enterprise, yet a big effort to provide financial sustenance to the family. So, it is very crucial for them to grow this agribusiness and ensure that production is abundant and of good quality.

Puspa has an idea to cultivate paddy on their farmland. Being a staple food in the region, the demand for the crop has always been good. So, Puspa needs financial help to purchase agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation. This is why she is asking for a business loan from Kiva's field partner BJS. The loan amount will be used to purchase good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, and other such resources.

Puspa believes that a good production will take care of her financial expenses for the rest of the year. She will be able to save some, from which she plans to take a plot of agricultural land in the future for growing potatoes, another vegetable in demand throughout India.

She thanks BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Hiranbala

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Hiranbala lives in a village called Parengerpar in Falakata. This village is surrounded by forest. It helps the borrower because she prepares plywood’s raw materials from the tender wood of the forest and sells it to the plywood manufacturing mills to earn their livelihood.

Hiranbala lives with her husband and young son in a small house. The main source of income for Hiranbala's family is the business of supplying the raw materials for plywood manufacturing. Her husband purchases wood and cuts it into thin sheets and supplies them to the plywood manufacturing mills. All is done by him with Hiranbala's active support.

Their earnings from this business are just hand to mouth for her family. In spite of regular earnings, she is not able to improve her living conditions. So, she wants to overcome this situation by expanding the supply of raw materials, and she needs capital.

Hiranbala has applied for a loan from Kiva through BJS. From this loan amount, she is planning to purchase more wood and other necessary materials for the business. She is very much hopeful that this investment will fetch her more income to fulfill her dream of constructing a concrete house and giving a better life to her child.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for expanding her existing business.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar is 48, married to a farmer and has 5 daughters and 3 sons. Because the income from farming is very small, Kawthar started raising poultry to help her husband with the family income. 

She is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy birds such as chickens, ducks, pigeons and geese to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy birds such as chickens, ducks, pigeons and geese

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 52, married to a housewife and has 4 sons and 2 daughters. He is a farmer but his income can't cover the family's monthly expenses. 

He started a grocery store project and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as oil, cheese and pasta to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy grocery products such as oil, cheese and pasta.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Senhora Alice tem 39 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando o ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família aqual sustenta com ajuda do seu esposo.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de banhos marias, mantas, fatos, cadeiras em território vizinho para revender no mercado nacional.
No futuro pretende abrir uma mercearia visto que agora vende de forma ambulatória fazendo entregas nas mercearias.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Alice is 39 years old and in a common law marriage. She has four children, two of whom are in primary and secondary school respectively. She's a trader and lives with her family in a house that she owns. She supports her family with the help of her husband.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase bain-maries, blankets, suits, and chairs in the neighboring territory so that she can re-sell them at the local market.
In the future Alice intends to open a grocery store, since she currently sells door-to-door and delivers to grocery stores.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency in order to guarantee her future loans.

loans.use: to purchase bain-maries, blankets, suits and chairs for re-selling.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 49 years old and is a seamstress in El Alto. She makes Andean skirts and blankets. She learned about the business many years ago. Cristina has a store but it doesn't belong to her. She also uses the store as a workshop. Cristina needs a loan to buy more items to make skirts and blankets. She has a daughter and hopes you can help her to improve her family's situation. Cristina would like to have enough money to move to another city and work there.

loans.use: to buy items to make skirts and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber for selling.

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.en:
Mathlide is 38 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 8 years and 3 of them go to school. She owns a shop and she has been in a business for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sweets,salt, sugar and other items for selling. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. In future, she aims to earn at least 100,000 per month.

loans.use: to buy more sweets, salt, sugar and other items for selling.

loans.name: Saghaba

texts.fr: Saghaba est agriculteur inscrit à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Congola au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Âgé de 75 ans, Saghaba est le père de 13 enfants âgés de 17 à 54 ans, dont 8 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Saghaba à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs sur sa parcelle de 1 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour cultiver le maïs. L’accès au semoir lui permettra de faciliter mes travaux champêtres comme le semis. Saghaba espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants  et construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Saghaba is a farmer. A member of myAgro, he lives and works in the village of Congola, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. Saghaba is 75 years old and the father of thirteen children between the ages of 17 and 54. Eight of the children are currently in school.

Saghaba was motivated to become a farmer by a family tradition anchored in agricultural practice as the main source of household’s revenues and food self-reliance, but also because farming allowed him to guarantee his family’s independence. He farms corn on his 2.5-acre lot, but as a farmer confronts difficulties such as droughts and lack of farming material.

This year, he wanted to purchase a seeder to farm corn. Getting the seeder will make his work in the field, such as seeding, easier. With increased productivity and revenues, Saghaba hopes to be able to cover his children’s school expenses and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to own a precision seeder.

loans.name: Gayatri Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sanadei is the featured borrower for the Gayatri SHG-B Group. She is standing at the left. She joined with her group member Gauri to request this loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Sanadei and her loan group member are working hard to develop their businesses and improve their living at the same time.

Sanadei is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. Two years ago, she started to prepare and sell food, such as bada, samosa, puri, chhola, idli (Odisha's breakfast and snack item) etc., from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business.

Sanadei and her group member are requesting a loan amount of 24,000 INR. Sanadei will use her portion of the group loan from the Kiva field partner Peoples Forum to buy necessary raw materials such as oil, vegetables, rice, rice flour, sugar, fruits, and other products. Her loan will help her increase her production, satisfy her customers, and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as oil, vegetables, rice, flour, sugar, fruits, and other products.

loans.name: Anastancia

texts.pt:
Senhora Anastácia tem 41 anos de idade, é solteira, polícia, vive em casa própria com uma sobrinha que está sob sua responsabilidade.
O montante financiado será aplicado para compra de cimento, varões, barrotes, pranchas para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa, mobilar e ainda pretende iniciar um negócio de modo a angariar mais fundos para o sustento familiar visto que o salário não e suficiente para suportar as despesas.
O seu maior desafio é de entrar no ensino superior e fazer a licenciatura em psicologia, e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora.
texts.en:
Anastácia is 41 years old and single. She's a police officer and lives in a house that she owns. She lives with a niece who's under her responsibility.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase cement, rods, beams and planks so that she can continue building her house.
In the future Anastácia intends to finish building her house and furnish it. She also intends to start a business in order to raise more funds to support her family. This is because her salary isn't enough to afford the expenses.
Her biggest challenge is getting into college and graduating in psychology. Another challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rods, beams and planks so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a widow with a son. She owns her own house and is trying to rebuild it and finish a room with another loan. Cristina works hard and is the only one that supports her family. She knows the construction work takes a lot of time but she is ready to endure it. 

She hopes you can help her again. In the picture you can see that the room is not finished.

loans.use: to finish a room in her house.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, 42, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the welfare of her family

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Serm, 61, lives in a community of Banteay MeanChey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 3.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine for the health of her family

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 25 years old and single with two children, one of whom in school, Flordeliza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 1 year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Uris Ivette

texts.es:
Uris, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado en una empresa que vende agua y tienen un hijo de 7 años de edad. 

Uris, tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace 6 meses que está ubicada dentro de la escuela de la comunidad; decidió comprar el puesto porque la dueña del puesto se fue de la comunidad y se lo vendía barato, anteriormente ella vendía de manera ambulante, ahora se le hace más fácil vender. Su casa está a 100 metros de la escuela  y en ocasiones su pareja le ayuda en la venta cuando tiene tiempo libre. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar golosinas, gaseosas, pan y dulces para el cafetín, estos son los productos que más compran los niños de la escuela; con esta inversión espera ganar más de lo hasta ahora vende. 

El sueño es de Uris, es construir el cafetín de ladrillos para tenerlo fijo, porque actualmente es de lámina, ella espera que su negocio siempre este generando buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios del cafetín y de4 la casa.
texts.en:
Uris, who is 36 years old, went to school through sixth grade. She is married, and her husband is employed by a business that sells water. They have a 7-year-old son.

Uris has had a little shop for 6 months that is located inside the community school. She decided to buy the stand because the owner of the stand left the community and was selling it cheaply. Previously, she was selling as a street vendor. Now this makes it easier to sell. Her house is 100 meters from the school, and sometimes her husband helps her with the sales when he has free time.

She needs the loan to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, and sweets for the cafe. These are the products that the children of the school buy most. With this investment, she hopes to earn more than she did previously.

Uris' dream is to build the cafe from bricks, to make it permanent, because now it is made of metal sheeting. She hopes that her business always generates good earnings to pay the daily expenses of the cafe and of the household.

loans.use: to buy candies, soft drinks, bread, and sweets for the cafe

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.en:
Flor is a 55 years old widow who lives in Fresno. She started her business around 6 years ago, a food selling job that she loves to do and want to see grow in the future. She is a hard worker and responsible woman who wishes to see all her dreams come true. 

She asked for a loan so she can buy some cooking tools and wholesale inputs so she can buy more food stocks at better prices.  This way she can improve her clients and sales. With this she will open her first local restaurant because right now she doesn’t possess one and this has been something that she has wanted since she began her business. 

Flor wants someday to be able to repair her house because it a little damaged, so she can live protected and comfortable. You can help her to accomplish all her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: buy some cooking tools and wholesale inputs for her food preparation business

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 36 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Rosana has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is a 48-year-old married woman from Falakata. She is a mother of four grown up sons; all of her sons are engaged in their respective work. She lives in a small village, Lotapata, in Falakata of West Bengal.

She is a dedicated housewife who takes care of her family. Her husband is engaged in agricultural activities along with three of their sons. He cultivates potatoes, carrots, beans, and gourds on his farmland and sells his produce in the local markets. However, a major part of the harvest is sold to the wholesale dealers in the market. Though Minu is a housewife, she tries to help her husband in his farm work. Now, with the growing needs of his family, they need to increase their harvest for more profit. So, he has decided to cultivate paddy, the much-demanded crop in their region.

So, Minu has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase paddy seeds as well as chemical and organic fertilizers and pesticides so that her husband has a good harvest this year from which they can earn more. Some of her biggest dreams are to buy more farmland to get more production and to build a concrete house for her family’s well being.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Katia es una mujer de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 4, 6 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, constante, generosa, optimista, dedicada, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que es un lugar especial para los pobladores porque se encuentra el altar de la Virgen, La leyenda cuenta que la imagen fue encontrada por dos campesinos quienes vieron un resplandor que venia del interior del tronco de un árbol, cuando ellos se acercaron encontraron la imagen de la Virgen. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Katia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lacio, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (fila de atrás, la primera de la derecha, viste polera blanca). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como electricista y con sus hijos; los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida; ella se dedica a la venta de ‘patasca’ que es un caldo que se prepara con mote, mondongo, carne de res, y se utiliza la cabeza del carnero que le da un sabor peculiar a esta preparación, “solo vendo patasca, mis clientes llegan desde muy lejos a comer y no tengo donde atenderlos porque no cuento con muebles de comedor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ‘patasca’ es una comida muy conocida y apreciada, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un local propio donde pueda vender comida, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Katia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para que sus clientes coman sentados y no pierda ventas.
texts.en:
Katia is a 31 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has three children aged 4, 6 and 8 years old. Her business is selling traditional meals.

She is a good mother, consistent, generous, optimistic, dedicated, responsible and very hard-working She does her business in the‘Cotoca’ area which is a special place for the inhabitants as it has the Altar of the Virgin. Legend says that the image was found by two farmers who saw a glow that came from the trunk of a tree and as they came closer they found the image of the Virgin. It has a hot sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 to 35 degrees Celsius.

Katia is dark-skinned, with dark eyes, long straight black hair is short and thin. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks in her home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (In the photo she is in the back row, the first to the right, wearing a white shirt). She shares her life with her partner who works as an electrician and her children. The oldest two study in school and the youngest is not yet school age. They live in a house that is property of their family made of wood with a metal roof and cement floor. It has well water from a pump, electricity but no sewage.

Her business is selling food. She works making patasca which is a soup that is made with boiled grains, intestines, beef, and uses the head of a sheep to give it flavour unique to this dish. "I only sell patasca. My clients come from a long ways to eat and I don't have a place to serve them as I don't have cafe furniture" she comments. The advantage of her business is that patasca is a very well-known and liked dish and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy tables and chairs to serve her clients.

This is her first loan with the institution in the two years she has run this business. For these reasons Katia is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs so her clients can eat sitting down and she doesn't lose sales.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs so her clients can eat sitting down and she doesn't lose sales.

loans.name: Elina

texts.pt:
Senhora Elina tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 2 filhos frequentando o ensino primário, trabalha num banco comercial como assistente de back office, vive em casa da mãe, não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de óleo, arroz, açúcar, refrescos, velas, bolachas, sal para revender em sua mercearia.
No futuro pretende construir casa própria e ampliar o seu negócio fornecendo os produtos em grandes quantidades.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos e realizar mais rápido os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Elina is 33 years old and in a common law marriage. She has two children who are in primary school. She works in a commercial bank as a back office assistant. She lives with her mother and doesn't support anyone else.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase cooking oil, rice, sugar, refreshments, candles, crackers and salt for re-selling in her grocery store.
In the future Elina intends to build her own house and expand her business by supplying merchandise in large quantities.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency. That way she'll guarantee her future loans and accomplish her projects more quickly.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, sugar, refreshments, candles, crackers and salt for re-selling in her grocery store.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Senhora Marta tem 51 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais duas estão na sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino superior, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de carnes, refrescos, bebidas alcoólicas para ampliar o seu negócio.
No futuro pretende comprar carro para o transporte pessoal e de mercadorias, construir mais estabelecimentos comerciais como forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos, e sustentar a educação das filhas até terminar os estudos.
texts.en:
Marta is 51 years old and single. She has six children, two of whom are in college and under her responsibility. She's a trader and lives with her family in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase meat, refreshments, and alcoholic beverages so she can expand her business.
In the future Marta intends to buy a car for personal use and merchandise transportation. She also intends to set up more stores as a way to improve her family's income.
Her challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency in order to guarantee her future loans. Another challenge is providing her daughters with an education until they finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase meat, refreshments, and alcoholic beverages in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Dominga Claudina

texts.es:
Dominga, de 39 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque sus padres no la mandaban a la escuela, ella está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en un molino, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres estudian.

Dominga, trabaja vendiendo pupusas por las tardes, pero también se dedica a trabajar en el molino junto con su esposo, ya tienen 20 años de administrar el molino, este trabajo nació de la necesidad de obtener ingresos y también porque en la zona no hay molinos cercanos y el horario de atención es de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprarle un repuesto al vehículo en el cual salen a comprar los insumos para realizar la venta, porque tuvieron un accidente que solo dejo daños materiales y el carro es el único medio de trasporte de ellos y le es necesario que lo tengan en buen estado. 

Dominga, sueña con tener buena salud para poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Dominga is 39 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to study, because her parents did not send her to school.  She is in a relationship and her partner works in a mill.  She has four children, of which three go to school.  

Dominga works selling pupusas in the evenings, but also spends time working in the mill with her spouse.  They have already been managing the mill for twenty years.  This work was born out of the necessity of obtaining income and also because in the area there are not nearby mills and the working hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

She needs this loan to buy a spare part for their vehicle in order to go out and buy the supplies to make her sales.   They had an accident that left physical damages, and the car is their only means of transportation.  It is necessary that they have it in good condition.

Dominga dreams of having good health to be able to continue working and help her children be prepared academically.

loans.use: to buy a spare part for their vehicle with which they go out to buy the supplies to make her sales.

loans.name: Jorge Duque

texts.en:
Jorge lives in Mariquita, Antioquia, a really beautiful town where he owns a store since last year. He’s 50 years old and lives with his girlfriend. He works for 10 hours a day all the week because he loves his business and is really committed to improve it every day and be able to attract more customers.

He has a goal to get more clients, so with those the sales and the profits increase, so he’s asking for a loan that let him buy a lot of inputs of different products that customers has been asking for and to stock up with sodas and beers. If everything turns like he wants he will improve her local so it looks better and more attractive to all the people. 

The inputs for his store are really expensive, that’s why he’s needing some help that you can give through a loan that not only will help him with his business but with his dream of reform and improve his home so it gives him better protection. A little help can change Jorge’s life.

loans.use: buy a lot of inputs of different products

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Bishakha is a housewife who depends on her husband’s income for her daily needs. Her husband is the only breadwinner of the family. She is 36 years old and a mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son reads in grade 11. Her daughter, Barnali, is 17 years old and reads in grade 12 at Falakata Girls' High School.

Bishakha looks after her children at home and does the household chores daily. Her husband is a farmer by profession. The small income he derives from cultivation work hardly meets their household requirements. It is difficult to manage the annual tuition fees of his children for each new session for a low-income family. Her daughter, Barnali, got an average mark in the grade 11 exam. She has a dream to be a teacher in future, so she wants to join coaching classes. She also needs different reference books and other education materials so that she can pass, securing good marks.

So Bishakha is applying for an education loan from BJS. With the Kiva loan, she will pay for the annual school expenses without any delay so that her daughter can join the new school session on time, and to buy study materials and a bicycle for her. Bishakha is very happy to take the loan and said that her burdens are lightened. 

Bishakha and Barnali (as in the photo) are very happy for the loan and convey thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's 12th grade education.

loans.name: Lakshiya

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Lakshiya lives in a small village of Falakata with her family, comprising of her husband, Harindra, and three daughters. Her daughters are studying in different grades. Her husband is engaged with a sugarcane business. 

Lakshiya gives financial support to her husband by selling milk and cattle byproducts like cow dung in her local area. Her neighbors are the main customers. Now she decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase another dairy cow so that she can sell more milk to increase her family income. 

She is struggling a lot to earn money so that her children do not suffer from poverty. Lakshiya is very courageous and ambitious to expand her business because she is confident that she can give her children a good education and run the family smoothly with the profit from her business. 

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a rural, hardworking, woman of only 32 years from Falakata of West Bengal. She is married to Dipak, a 46-year-old farmer. Together they are raising their one son and one daughter with love and care. Kalpana wants to provide her children with a good education, thus she sends them to school. 

Kalpana’s husband is a very hard-working man. He cultivates on his ancestral land. He mainly grows paddy rice. He thinks his business goes well because he has a lot of knowledge about its production and always offers quality products. He supplies his paddy to the rice dealers in the nearby market. 

In order to strengthen her family business and respond to client demand, Kalpana is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing better quality paddy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds. With this investment, at the end of the harvest, they will be able to have a better production, and with his earnings, they can improve their family’s quality of life.

In the future, she wants to purchase more land with the profit of their business.

Kalpana is very thankful for Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Aloka

texts.en:
Aloka is a 31-year-old, rural housewife from the small village of Falakata in the district of Alipurduar. She lives there with her husband and two sons, who are students of different grades. Aloka and her husband could not complete their secondary grade education due to the financial problems of their families. 

Aloka’s husband is a farmer. To take care of the family's needs, he is extensively engaged in agribusiness. He sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of income for the family. In order to continue developing their agribusiness in a sustainable way and at the same time cultivate paddy (rice) on their farmland, Aloka needs capital to invest. She has taken out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan amount to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers and other farm resources. 

Aloka dreams this business will enable her to earn extra profit which will give financial support to her family to fulfill their basic needs and educate her sons properly. She dreams to purchase more farmland in the future with the profit from her business.

Aloka sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm resources for farming good quality paddies.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime has a girlfriend as well as a son. He is a farmer and a mason. Jaime needs another loan to buy tools; he is ready to work hard and hopes you can help him. Jaime's girlfriend is helping him but he realizes that in order to give his son a better life he needs to improve his services as a mason.

loans.use: to buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Senhora Marta tem  vive maritalmente, é mãe de 6 filhos frequentando do ensino primário a superior respectivamente, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cadeiras plásticas, cestos de roupas, banheiras, roupas em território vizinho para revender no mercado nacional como forma de aproximar o produto junto ao consumidor.
No futuro pretende continuar com a construção da sua casa visto que agora conta com dois quartos e não é suficiente para uma família grande.
O seu maior desafio é de ver seus filhos formados e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Marta is in a common law marriage. She has six children who attend grades ranging from primary school to college. She's a trader and lives with her family in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase plastic chairs, laundry baskets, bathtubs, and clothing in the neighboring territory. That way she can re-sell them at the local market and bring the merchandise closer to the customer.
In the future Marta intends to continue building her house, since it currently has two bedrooms and it's not big enough for a large family.
Her biggest challenge is seeing her children graduate from college. Another challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency as a way to guarantee her future loans.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs, laundry baskets, bathtubs, and clothing for re-selling.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla has been doing hair since she was 12. Just four years ago, she decided to take her talent more seriously and earned her cosmetology license from the Paul Mitchell Cosmetology School in Florida. It only took her three years after her graduation to realize that opening her own beauty salon was the next step for her. 

She is passionate about what she does and enjoys being able to provide top-notch customer service at her salon. She runs her business alone and takes pride in having funded her business venture with money out of her own pocket. 

She is currently seeking a loan to increase her marketing budget and purchase equipment that will allow her to hire a second stylist. She would also like to build up a small amount of capital for unexpected expenses.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and build capital for unexpected expenses

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Agnes works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Agnes is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of firewood to sell for her firewood business.

Agnes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a married woman with three children. She is 44 years old and all three children are sent to school.

Julieta is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and she has a fishing business in the Philippines. Julieta requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Julieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with two children. She is 33 years old and both of her children are in school.

Flordeliza is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries. Flordeliza has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, bread, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a single man and living with his parents.  Jose is a musician and is member of a band, so he has to go to many celebrations if he wants to make some money. 

Jose is studying Business Administration and he needs another loan to pay the tuition at the university. 

 Right now Jose is the only one at his home that makes money, so that is why he needs help again  He will get a discount at the university if he makes this payment, so he hopes you can help him again

loans.use: to pay his university fee for studying Business Administration

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Senhora Rosa vive maritalmente com o seu esposo, é mãe de 4 filhos que ainda estão na sua responsabilidade dos quais dois estudam frequentando o ensino primário, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de fardos de roupa usada para revender no mercado próximo da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia, reabilitar a sua casa de modo a dar conforto básico aos seus filhos e comprar carro para o transporte pessoal e de mercadorias do seu negócio.
O seu maior desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Rosa is in a common law marriage with her husband. She has four children who are still under her responsibility, and two of her children are in primary school. She's a trader who lives with her family in a house that she owns.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling at the market that's near her home.
In the future Rosa intends to build a grocery store and repair her house in order to provide basic comfort for her children. She also intends to purchase a car to use for personal transportation and to carry merchandise for her business.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency as a way to guarantee her future loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing for re-selling at the market near her home.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 36 years old, married and has two children. She wants to help her husband to earn a living and be able to help also for her children's needs, so she has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for six years already, earning an income of PHP 2,000 a month that helps them with so much of their needs. 

She aims to increase her income, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more good items to sell and increase her store inventory so that it will generate her income.

Perlita's plan for the future is to expand her business more from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old and single.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, bread, etc.

Delia has been in this business for 9 years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, cooking oil, bread, etc

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jessa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an internet café. Jessa is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like gasoline and fishing net for her fishing business.

Jessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like gasoline and fishing net.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 53 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 20 years. Elizabeth earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation). She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Dyline

texts.en:
Dyline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Dyline requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Dyline would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman with eleven children. She is 41 years old and four of her children are in school. 

Merlyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Merlyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is 42 years old. He lives with his pensioner parents, wife and 2 children in Kobuleti. The family has only seasonal income, as they have nut and mandarin trees. Badri is very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest, which is sold locally at a good price.
 
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing a cow. The family will start producing dairy products and will increase the income, which is much needed.   Badri already has a shed for the cow, as the family was involved in animal husbandry business years ago. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a dairy business to provide much needed income for his family

loans.name: Lielyn

texts.en:
Lielyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lielyn is 35 years old, and all three of her children are being sent to school.

Lielyn has a plasticware retail business in the Philippines. Lielyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of plasticware to sell.

Lielyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lielyn would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plasticware to sell.

loans.name: Narita

texts.en:
Narita is 43 years old and has three children. Narita is married, and two of her children are in school.

Narita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Narita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Narita has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Narita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Snoul district of Kratie province, Sokhim is 36 years old and a mother of a dependent child. She struggles for a living via growing cassava to earn the main source of income to support her family. To supplement her income, she sells some snacks in her community. She has been involved in her business for ages. Now, her cash crop grows slowly and she gets lower-than-expected outputs. 

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR for each member. She wisely used her past loan to improve her living standard. For this second loan, Sokhim, the leader of a group of four members, will use her loan to buy organic herbicide to kill weeds in her farmland so that the crop can grow better and produce good outputs. She hopes to give great care to her cassava farm so that it can produce good outputs and earn a good income to support her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy organic herbicide to kill weeds in her farmland so that the crop can grow better and produce good outputs.
